stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars
name: CJ

review: UberEats itself is a wonderful concept and great app, but their customer service is seriously lacking. I have placed several orders where several items have been missing, and when I call Uber Eats to report the missing food, the only response I have gotten was that I would be refunded for the items. That's great and all, but what do I do with the people who have nothing to eat because they didn't receive their order??? Why is it not in the policy to contact the restaurant and ask them to deliver the missing food items??? Last night my family and I ordered over $100 worth of food for dinner. After an hour, my son was literally crying because he was hungry. The time for delivery kept extending later and later. I received a phone call from the restaurant itself. Apparently the driver picked up the wrong food. He said he would be contacting Uber and they would contact me. Another 10-15 minutes went by before I finally heard from Uber. The woman who called me from Uber spoke barely any English and was extremely difficult to understand. She informed me that my order had been canceled, I would be refunded, and if I wanted, I could go back to the app and place another order. I was confused by this. S instead of just figuring out the mix-up with the driver and getting me the correct food, I had to place another order and wait ANOTHER hour?!?!?! As I was asking the woman to clarify why that needed to be done, she literally began to talk over me, as if I was not even speaking. Then she tried to dismiss me and end the call and I asked her to wait because I still had questions. She again ignored me and spoke over me and then hung up on me! Let me make this clear: SHE HUNG UP ON A CUSTOMER WHO WAS ASKING FOR HELP IN CLARIFYING THE SITUATION!!! As someone who has worked in customer service for over 15 years, I found this absolutely unacceptable. When a situation like this mix-up happens, which I was completely understanding of and not at all irate, a customer service representative should have been kind and apologetic, offering solutions and listening to any questions I might have, NOT talk over me, ignore me, and then hang up on me.To make matters worse, I called Uber Customer Service to complain about this rude representative, and the woman I spoke to at that time was very kind and helpful, and she apologized for the other representative, and told me that a supervisor would be calling me later on in the evening. I asked her if they would be calling me that same night and she said yes. Well, here it is, the next day, and my phone has yet to ring. So Uber Eats itself is great. But their customer service is seriously lacking!!!

review: I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with the service I received from Uber Eats, specifically regarding an order I placed with Soi Thai in Clapham. Unfortunately, my experience has been nothing short of appalling.After purchasing a meal through Uber Eats from Soi Thai, I suffered from a severe case of food poisoning. Distressed by this, I promptly contacted Uber Eats seeking assistance and resolution to this health hazard. To my dismay, the response I received was both unhelpful and dismissive.The lack of concern and assistance displayed by Uber Eats in handling such a critical issue is utterly unacceptable. As a customer, I expected a responsible and prompt resolution to ensure the safety of all patrons. The refusal to address my concerns is indicative of a poor commitment to customer welfare and highlights the inadequacy of Uber Eats in managing food quality issues.Considering the severity of the matter, I feel compelled to report this incident to the relevant health and safety authorities. It is disheartening that such a trusted platform as Uber Eats fails to take responsibility for the potential health risks posed by its affiliated restaurants.I strongly urge Uber Eats to reevaluate its customer service protocols and prioritize the health and safety of its patrons. Neglecting such issues not only tarnishes the reputation of your service but also poses serious risks to the well-being of your customers.This experience has left me deeply dissatisfied and concerned about the standards upheld by Uber Eats. I hope that steps will be taken to rectify these issues promptly.

review: I am a longtime customer. I have been ordering takeaways and groceries from them for years. Today is my last day as a customer. After my experience this evening, I would rather walk through snow barefoot to pick up my food, because that would feel more pleasant than dealing with Ubereat’s robot customer service.My order never arrived, I have evidence on my door camera and concierge downstairs, no sighting of a delivery driver.The delivery driver never contacted me and left the food out at a random building (with a blurry photo of the food next to a concrete wall…who knows where).I never got any notifications from the driver regarding issues in finding my apartmentI had even ordered another item earlier in the day (and many times of the past few years) with no issues. I have never had a driver not be able to locate my current apartment. I make the instructions clear, keep my phone near me and always have my notifications on.Ubereats sided with the driver, despite no evidence of them delivering the food to me or contacting me. And I got charged for the food…unbelievable!This is apparently common practice as some ubereats drivers just can’t be bothered, wait outside a random location and claim to have tried to contact you and just take a photo of it next to a random wall (and it’s nowhere near where you actually live). And UberEats will side with the driver because they wait the amount of time needed for whatever aweful policy they have to charge the customer.Go with Deliveroo - this never happens with them.Ubereats used to be a great business - it’s a shame their automated customer service and policies don’t side with customers. It seems silly as there are so many other great providers and competition on the market.

review: I had placed an order from UberEats and gave instructions for the delivery driver to come to the front of my building as many will, for whatever reason, go to the back.  My driver sent me a text saying he was here and I told him I was at the front, even mentioning that there were instructions for him to go there.  Instead of driving to the front of the building, he walked my food - in the middle of cold (-8 C) weather - to the front.  Because my building is large, my order was cold and inedible.  I contacted customer service via the app 4 times and all 4 times was disconnected without resolution.  I had requested a refund or a credit in the amount of my order, but they refused; stating it was against their policy to do so.  The last agent I was chatting with at least offered to have a supervisor call me back.The supervisor, Angel, did call me at 1 in the morning.  He kept cutting me off when I tried to explain the issue and then proceeded to get upset because I raised my voice.  I told him I had been in customer service for years and have offered full credit whenever an issue arose, which was rare. I will admit, I did curse at him, but this was after him not understanding the situation that they technically stole money from me as I was unable to have my meal.  SHAME ON UBEREATS AND THEIR POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!

review: Absolutely appalled by the response from Ubereats regarding my Iceland order missing more than 50% of the items ordered.Uber are refusing to refund me as I have had previous issues with orders and had other refunds for missing items. Whilst I understand there are some people who may have scammed Uber this is incredibly unfair to just assume I have done the same!I have tried everything I can to get the items delivered to me - I even called the store who told me 2 of the 4 bags were never collected and Uber have now cancelled the transaction with Iceland.Due to the current climate fund's are low for everyone and I used the last of my money to buy food for my children, one of whom is diabetic and needs to eat meals regularly. Between my husband and myself we simply haven't had the time to physically go to the shop and relied on this service, now I have no available funds to buy more food and have had to borrow money from my neighbour just to be able to eat dinner this evening all thanks to Uber!!! who have showed no remorse for their error and are simply refusing to resolve the issue and accuse me of scamming you!!!!A simple call to the store would have resolved this, but despite messaging numerous times through social media, we have been left with no option but to dispute this transaction with our bank who have said they will refund the entire order not just missing items, which is all I am asking for.Uber you are a disgrace you claim You're there for the convenience but if you cannot accept responsibility for you/ your driver's error then what use are you?I have had issues with other delivery companies in the past and never been treated in such a poor manner!

review: I have been you using the Uber eats now for quite a sometime even I do have Uber one currently. The recent order was totally disaster. Before I order I put in the instructions section clearly where my flat located, however, the rider still couldn’t find the flat anyway I explained to him on the phone for 8 minutes he still couldn’t manage the find the flat then after 7 minutes talking on the phone he said come get your f*king food from near the where he was, and I said to him McDonald is only 4 minutes walk from my flat but due to rain and late hour I couldn’t leave the house because I was babysitting my little daughter anyway that was the main reason I ordered from the app otherwise I would walk and buy it myself.Anyway, end of the phone conversation he said come and get @f*king order I’m gonna take it back then he hang up the phone and cancelled the order. I contact with the Uber eats through them app and they are other joke side of the story, they told me driver tried to contact you make sure update your phone number and keep the phone near you. I sent them a screenshot of 8 minutes talk on the phone the live agent ridiculously said same thing. I’m not even too sure if they are reading the messages properly. I didn't get the food and I charged £18.50. I dont mind about the money but the way they treat them customers is not acceptable. It was my last order from them from now on I make sure my family will not use them app. Please also give a little instructions to your driver, if they can’t manage the find the property they don’t need to swear on the phone to the customer. In addition, I do pay for the food to deliver to me my front door, which is what I selected on the app “meet at my front door” I didn’t choose a option meet me somewhere in the town.

review: UberEats sent me someone else’s food order and then refused to refund my order because it goes against their ‘standard’, even though I presented them with proof. I am a vegetarian and they brought food containing meat that I could have become very ill from consuming. Their customer service is AI generated and just sends the same templated answers over and over again. They stole nearly $100 from me. From doing some research it sounds like this regularly happens to their customers. I will NEVER use this service again!Edit: After reaching out to their customer service for days and days (being hung up on and treated like trash) I did eventually get a refund, but I had to call them 3x and reach out 15+ times over the app. I will still never use their service again.

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with a recent experience I had with your service. On 04/01/24 at approximately 5:30pm , I placed an order through the Uber Eats app for delivery to my address.To my dismay, the food never arrived, despite the estimated delivery time having passed. I waited patiently, but there was no sign of the delivery driver. Strangely, the app indicated that my order had been successfully delivered, which is far from the truth. This has left me both frustrated and inconvenienced.What adds to my dismay is that I was charged for the undelivered order. I find it utterly unacceptable to be charged for a service that was not rendered as expected. I demand an immediate investigation into this matter and a prompt resolution. I request a refund for the full amount charged for my order.I understand that unforeseen circumstances may occur, but communication is key. A simple notification or explanation for the delay or non-delivery would have been appreciated.I urge you to take swift action in rectifying this issue to restore my trust in Uber Eats. Please respond promptly with the steps you will be taking to address this matter and process the refund.Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a timely resolution.

review: I will be writing to complain.  I tried to order a meal from a restaurant to be told at the end that the order could not be accepted on Uber.  We ordered directly from the restaurant.  Shortly after the restaurant called us to say they had received an identical order from Uber and they called us as it was clearly a duplicate - they cancelled this order.  Uber then sent me an email saying that the order had been cancelled however the restaurant had started preparing the food  - so they were charging me the full amount plus delivery.  I had not paid for the cancelled order - but they decided to use the card details held for my uber taxi account to take the money. Clearly the food was not prepared as the restaurant kindly called us and I assume that Uber Eats pocketed the lot.  Will not be using them again, deceitful people.

review: I would give zero if I could.  I have ordered from UberEats several times in the last year but a couple of months ago I placed an order and then realised I had missed out a side dish.  I cancelled the first order, called the restaurant to make them aware of it and placed a second larger order with the same restaurant within minutes. The restaurant was aware of it. I have not been refunded for the first order.  Today I have seen an explanation saying that no refund is due because the restaurant had already started preparing the order.  That is total rubbish as the restaurant is one of my regular local places and I simply increased the order and did not change it.  What a bunch of thieves!  They don't even have a complaints procedure I was told after waiting on the phone for 20 minutes for customer services.  I would highly recommend you don't use them.  JustEats is so much more decent. They have a phone line you can call if something goes wrong and a refunds policy.  I am escalating this to my credit card company and will post this more widely on social media. Hope you are taking note UberEats!

They sent me an email saying that they cannot assist me due to the fact that my complaint is more than 48 hours after the order was processed. Trying to explain to them the situation over email, but they keep on saying they cannot assist and will be closing the communication line. There is no other way of getting in touch with them. review: Do not trust them with your card information. I ordered groceries for delivery and never got them due to the delivery person who got an attitude because she didn't follow directions. I went to Ubereats to get my refund for purchases never received. I was at ease at first once I got it back. Shortly after, I got an notification about a pending $77.69 that I didn't spend at all it was actually $55.69  . But obviously due to items not being available it went down. When i got the notification about the $77.69 came through $24.84 came out of my account. Now if anyone knows math I had $15.00 left after $24.84 came out. Add it together it was deducted from the refund. The first person I spoke to put me on hold for 10 minutes, and someone else picked up the call. Everything went left when she tried to discredit the receipts I was able to prove. She wanted to argue and say I was wrong. I called back a little later and someone actually did try to help get this resolved. Keep in mind all my information is private and no one else outside of me had it. There is a investigation into my missing funds and with the transactions as well. I won't be using this company ever again. It is beyond sickening how they treat customers using their services. Save yourself the headache and seek other means.

review: I tried to order with Uber Eats on Dec 27th, 2023 for the first time and wanted to use the Coupon that I received for $30 off for the first order with FIRSTEATS30 that expired on Dec 31st 2023.When going to the checkout, Uber Eats automatically applied an offer for “no delivery fee” instead of the coupon for $30 off. We tried several times to apply the $30 off coupon code and each time, Uber Eats applied the free delivery offer instead. This is called bait and switch and is illegal. There was no way to opt out of the no delivery fee offer.  I wanted to document that and tried taking a screenshot. By accident I placed the order for the full price, with no $30 discount. I called the restaurant immediately to stop preparing the dishes. It took me about 3 min to figure out how to cancel the order on the app. Then I started a help chat with 3 different agents Roshinikumar, Manuel and Aamir. All 3 said they are not able to refund and are holding back $51.71 from a $63 order because they claimed that the restaurant has already started to prepare the food.  I informed them that this was not the case. Later, I spoke with another agent on the phone who called up the restaurant and refunded me the “stolen” money. This multi million or maybe even billion business had absolutely crappy customer service and did not stand up to their offer to give $30 off for the first order.I will NEVER EVER recommend this business and NEVER order from them. This is a shame and a big discrace!!Better customer service is definitely necessary! Following through with offers is a legal requirement, that is basic consumer law!

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars
name: DR

review: I wish I can give zero stars.Let me start by saying after ordering nearly 500 orders via Uber eats and more than 1000 rides with Uber, I have now deleted my account with them.Today I ordered food for my kids from Greggs. I put the order in at 2.20pm and about 10 min after they say the delivery guy is picking up my order. When it was about 2.45pm I wanted to cancel the order because I can see in the app that the delivery guy has been at the same spot for the last 15min and of course now by the time food now gets to me it cold and not fresh. The ETA time keeps on moving longer and longer. Bare in mind I have a child with learning difficulties who is waiting for his food.By now I got another ETA update which now said that the ETA is at 3.15pm which by now was nearly an hour since I initially made the order. When I initially made the order it said on the app that the estimate delivery was 25min. I now went into the chat app of Uber eats explaining to them the situation and asked for my delivery to be cancelled because it’s taking too long. The Uber eats app is not good at all. You send one message and then they will send you 5 to 6 messages at the same time which does not give you a chance to read all. I saw the message do you want to cancel and I said yes stating my reason and letting them know that the driver has been at the same spot which is not even at the restaurant for more than 20min. I then went through the thread and saw due to me cancelling they are charging me about £19. The food that I ordered was £20. These people whoever dealt with my case has no shame. After they took my money without any investigation regarding the ETA closed the chat which did not allow me to chat any further.I then called customer service which was no help at all. I then sent them an email aExplaining that the ETA kept changing and driver was at the same spot for more than 20min and that I only saw that they will charge me after I went through the chat thread but they responded saying that I wanted to cancel and so they did and at the end of the response they said “no response needed”. How horrible and disgusting is this customer service. They did not even bother to investigate why the delivery driver accepted the job but stayed on the same spot for more than 20min. These horrible people did not even consider that that money they took was to buy a meal for my son with learning disability.No investigation was made regarding the driver.Many times I’ve ordered and I can see the driver took the job but the driver would take their own time to deliver. Many times my order is wrong, many times I receive an order where the food is spilled but I don’t really complain but today this company has made a fool out of me and took money from me, money that was meant to buy my son a meal from his favourite restaurant. I am extremely disappointed by this company, their customer service and their  delivery service.We are paying a fee, we are paying the drivers so why are drivers allowed to pick up your order when they feel like doing so. Why were their no investigation into the delivery guy’s ETA or why was he at the same spot for more than 20min. Uber Eats needs to know that their service is not free. We pay for the food and delivery service so why are we treated as if they are doing us a favour and as if the service is free.As said I am so disappointed and disgusted with this company.

review: 6£ for a loaf of bread from the grocery store next door ffs. Misleading advertisement, once you place an order an advertisement pops up “quick you still have 10 minutes to grab anything from grocery store” and once you fall for the trap and add anything from the grocery store you will be charged for it’s delivery fees separately. With every order trillion advertisement appears asking you to join Uber one (or whatever it’s name was) monthly plan to save money on your current order, once you fall for the scam and  join, they don’t refund you any fees as promised. After you join the monthly plan, another add pops up “quick now join the annual plan to save more money on your order” they cram all the ads together so you don’t know what to choose and just pay your money. Expensive delivery prices the cheapest was about 4£ in my area, I pay a quid or two in Deliveroo so no thanks Uber Eats. There’s no way to cancel an order literally immediately after you place it. Very difficult to speak to a human, no phone numbers around, if you have a complaint you’ll be stuck with a bot that will take you to the outer space before guiding you how to file a complaint and wait for couple days to get replies.More importantly, poor poor customer service experience, no sympathy with customers and poor emotional intelligence, they give zero care about the customer, literally like speaking to bots, perhaps their bots interacts better.I tried this app once, and I still regret it. Account deleted and I recommend if you want to save your money just avoid.

review: First and last time using uber eats. I placed the order online to buy the family some kfc as no-one was up to cooking. The order was placed at 9.10pm with an eatimated delivery of 10-15mins, with an note stating delivery at 10.15pm at the latest. The estimated delivery time changed repeatedly until it was 10.15pm and still showing as processing. Then the delivery time jumped to 10.35pm with the explanation that they couldn't find someone to deliver - so for the full hour they had no-one assigned to our order but just kept us waiting. For an exhausting amount of time we tried using the help section to cancel the order or speak with someone, but got nowhere. Ubereats does have a designated phone line but you will not find a number for it anywhere online (dec23). Eventually, we phoned the Uber taxi service, which Uber makes a point of telling you is geared for travelling customers. Funnily enough, it recognised the mobile number we used for the order and the answering service said it was transferring us to "uber eats". I do believe there is a degree of "spin" at work here, as we were then told the wait times were extensive and advised to call back later, seconds before putting us through to a rep, where we were able to cancel the order although we have to wait up to 5 working days for it to reach my bank. Disappointing and frustrating experience. Avoid unless you have time and money to waste.

review: I placed an order to be delivered from McDonalds on 1 Dec 2023 - it never arrived. I received a message via my online account nearly an hour later to say it had been delivered, when it had not.  I never received any communication from the driver nor did the driver answer any of my calls (before the delivered message was received) as I wanted to find out how long they would be/if there was a problem or delay.  I sent a text message to the driver asking what they had done with my order but got no response.  To make the situation worse, uber had also overcharged me.  I contacted help support and told them my order never arrived and wanted a refund.  They only refunded a quarter.  I send a number of other messages but the support team were dismissive stating the matter had been resolved and a refund given.  I wanted a full refund as I got no goods delivered. To date (28 Dec 2023), this matter has still not been resolved. Trying to take the matter further and who to make a complaint to is beyond a joke.  I have used uber eats before with no major issue but given this issue and the poor after customer service, I would not recommend them or use uber again.

I am under the assumption the driver had multiple deliveries to make, our food arrived. The food was stone cold. I phoned customer service which was of no use at all. I tried to escalate this and although I was put through to a "manager", he was a waste of time and breath speaking to. He kept quoting they couldn't do anything as it was delivered within a reasonable time and he was following his guidelines. When I asked what the guidelines were, he went on to quote the delivery time. When I told him again it was delivered after this time and the tracking was apologising for the order being late he still insisted that this was reasonable. We have used uber eats directly and through mcdonald's quite often due to our son and on the previous occasions when we have felt the need to call they have good. After this experience we will no longer be using there service and would advise anyone else against using them.

review: Uber Eats has illegally stolen hundreds of dollars from me. It said it was contacted by the uber eats support team, I contacted them, they told me that because the order was started I cannot receive a refund? So because the order was started, and never arrived, after waiting over an hour, i cannot receive a refund when they never gave me what I paid for.This is a common theme for uber eats. Within the last years of order from uber eats they have multiple times, with proof of food not being delivered or receiving the wrong food denied me a refund. The conduct of uber eats and the guidelines they have their employees follow is ILLEGAL. They are told to NOT refund or even respond to customers after they complain.On my previous Better Business Bureau  complaints #20673331, #20437713 & #20454894 each time they claimed they contacted me via email or in-app and each time, did not. Uber Eats tries to deceive the Better Business Bureau and those reading complaints by claiming they reached out and resolved the problem when they never did, they just hope that the person stops responding to the complaint follow ups.If I am not refunded the money from this order and last 2 complaints I did not receive a refund for I am going to be taking legal action. This time, they admitted the food did not come and will not be refunding me, last time the drop off location was wrong, which they admitted, the time before that the submitted picture from the driver showed no food being dropped off, I was denied a refund each time. I NEVER abused the refund system having spent thousands and having minimal refunds given.

review: I want to share my recent experience with Uber Eats, and unfortunately, it has been quite disappointing. Firstly, there's a concerning practice where they charge an additional £10 months after ordering, labeling it as a tip without prior notification. This could easily go unnoticed if you don't regularly check your bank statements.Moreover, I encountered a delivery issue where items were missing from my order, and despite contacting them, they refused to refund me without providing any explanation. I have preserved all communication records and screenshots highlighting their stance on not refunding even when the delivery was incomplete.To resolve the issue, I contacted my bank, and they refunded the amount, expressing displeasure at the situation. It's disheartening to see such practices from a service that many rely on.I advise everyone to exercise caution when using the Uber Eats app. Informing my family and friends led to them deleting the app due to similar concerns. It's essential to stay vigilant as it appears the app may be engaging in questionable practices.

review: First of all, their customer service is almost non-existent, it took me a lot of time to find a way to flag my issue.The problem was that I ordered food by mistake. The restaurant accepted the order immediately and I cancelled it right after. The whole thing took like 3 seconds, but UberEATS is not refunding me the money. According to them, once the restaurant accepts the order it means they are already preparing it, which in this case was physically impossible. It's like paying in a shop with a wrong bill and the cashier, that didn't even put it in the box yet, stands there with your bill in his/her hand refuses to give it back to you, saying he/she already bought supplies with it. Wouldn't you feel like you've been robbed?Additionally, this app used to have no additional fees. Then they started to charge a service fee, later a delivery fee and lastly the prices of most products are more expensive than they are in the restaurant's menu. You end up paying like extra 5-10€ for your order, and they have the nerve to offer you a "premium" membership to remove some of these additional fees, as if they are doing you a favor. They are greedy and unethical, and we are a lot of people feeling this way.

review: UberEats is an absolute nightmare, and I'm beyond frustrated with their terrible service. I've been waiting for a refund for an undelivered order for nearly a month, and their responses are nothing but a bunch of excuses. When I complained, they had the audacity to tell me, "It looks like you have already been refunded for this order." Really? Because my bank account begs to differ!According to their so-called "customer support," the refund should take 5-10 business days to reflect on my account. Well, guess what? It's been over 15 working days, and I'm still empty-handed. They conveniently blamed a mysterious "pending" amount on my bank statement, claiming it would disappear within 5-10 business days. Surprise, surprise – it did vanish, but my refund is nowhere to be found.As if that's not enough, UberEats also managed to overcharge me for a repeated order and, to add insult to injury, charged me double for the tip. Are they serious? This is nothing short of a scam! It's clear that UberEats is more interested in taking your money than delivering a reliable service. Save yourself the headache and look elsewhere for your food delivery needs. UberEats, you need to step up your game and start treating your customers with the respect they deserve.

review: I placed a £62 order for food for my family from McDonald’s - there was several items missing from the bag (McDonald’s fault i guess) but the food arrived stone cold! It had taken over an hour for the delivery. I had already paid a £6.20 tip to the Uber delivery guy and £3.99 for delivery - I called Uber eats to complain, the person on the phone I could tell was not taking a proper note of the items missing and he said said it would take 3 weeks to receive a refund for those items (NO REFUND RECEIVED and it’s been 5 weeks now), I asked for a refund on the tip and delivery charged because the food was so cold and not enjoyable - he said he cannot give a refund on that! I think it’s disgusting and a complete con! He kept telling me to contact McDonald’s too but on the McDonald’s app it says to contact Uber Eats! The guy on the phone at Uber Eats was just fobbing me off, I could tell straight away he wasn’t going to help just by the tone of his voice and carelessness he had. I could tell he wasn’t making a note of what I was saying. This business needs to be investigated because it’s fraud taking someone’s money and not providing a refund when due! I certainly won’t risk using them again.

review: UBER EATS DON'T CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS. I would give MINUS STARS if I could !!!!!  Yesterday I ordered a Mc Delivery from my local branch . Not for the first time items were missing. Obviously I rang Uber eats support line and told them the items that were missing. After being on hold I was told that for some reason ( I can only assume that because I have called on several occasions before about missing items ) that my refund was refused. I asked to speak to a manager and got the same response.  Uber eats was NOT prepared to reimburse me for a fault that was NOT my own !!! So the money for the missing items is basically THEFT .   given how poor the service is that I've received I would imagine that the attitude travels all the way up to the top. Trying to get some sort of resolution from UBER EATS is so difficult. Web sites make it as difficult as possible to complain. Trying to talk to anyone who gives a crap is impossible. AVOID UBER EATS at all COSTS . I have to say that MCDONALD'S CUSTOMER SERVICE eventually gave me some vouchers as a way of an apology, even though they are not responsible for refunds when food is delivered by uber eats, so credit to them.

review: Glitchy app not updated properly - refused refund for propblem with app. Difficult to get help with order issues, app purposefully designed to take you around in circles - hard to find or even ring customers services - I had to actually find a way to sneakily get through to their Uber Rider support to get a transfer to Customer Services (you can only ring when you have a live order).Full explanation of issue belowI made an order on my route home - the app was trying to deliver to my live location. I updated the app to drop off to my home address and placed the order. Unfortunately the app was still trying to deliver to the street I was on - the app does not let you update the order and theres no apparent way of updating order any other way. I had no choice but to cancel my food. I reordered and the app recognised second time that I'd updated to my home address. I want a refund for the first cancelled order - it was not my fault the app was not updating properly, and I also reordered immediately after so the food would not have been wasted as I reordered it - the specific takeaway also took ages with my order so was running behind so no food would have even been prepped on the first cancelled order. Explained this twice on phone and twice on app. Also falsely promised refund on phone. People on phone also seemed pretty disbondent.Chat feature also stops you responding to their responses.

review: Ubereats is awful.  Use ANYTHING else than them!  I have made 437 deliveries with them in about a year! This is hundreds of dollars in fees! It used to be great, fast delivery, good customer service and since about March 2023 it turned bad.  I had some issues with some orders where I had to beg to have compensation on missing items.  I have NEVER made a false report! On December 1st I decided to treat myself and order for 44.68$ of Starbucks, at this point I am an UberOne member as well, and please note in my area Starbucks is NOT in the UberOne location so I had to pay full fee and delivery.  I received everything EXCEPT one item worth 3.95$.  I looked into the help section and the option "missing item" was not there.  So I contacted help who refused to refund the missing item.  I was not asking much.  I was asking 3.95$/44.68$ they refused.  I took the conversion in screenshot, called PayPal, sent it to them and they agreed that this was not okay and refunded the 3.95$.  On December 14 due to having automatic payments UberEats charged me that 3.95$ again.  I contacted them, they said they would transfer me to a specialist and it would take 6 to 12h. On the 18th I wrote back saying with the lack of answer I am filing with PayPal again.  Today I cancelled my UberOne membership considering after this event they removed all my promotion.  Once cancelled they answered basically "no refund" again and didn't let me answer and closed the chat right away.  I have now sent all those new screenshots to PayPal, filed with them and officially deleted my account. DO NOT USE UBEREATS

name: WE

review: Having created a delivery order with one supermarket on the UBER app, I had not noticed that there was still ONE small item (milk) left in the cart from a second supermarket. Proceeding to check out, I authorised payment for the main delivery, however the UBER app somehow placed a second order for the small item not required.  No where during the process did the app inform me of this, nor did I authorise the additional order / payment.  The main delivery arrived, followed shortly by the incorrect order.  For context, the incorrect order item value was £1.50 - however after fee's and delivery charge it came to £11!!! Which, even if it had been a valid order, would amount to theft!! I quickly contacted UBER via the chat function, and explained the situation.  Suffice it say, UBER was not in the slightest interested in resolving the issue, and repeatedly explained that the order had been generated from a device associated to my account.  They basically dismissed my concern out of hand, and were not willing to accept that the issue was caused by the app.  I am completely disgusted with the attitude of UBER in this case, and warn all users to be vigilant when committing their hard earned money to this company.  UBER could have easily resolved this complaint by issuing a credit note or refund, but simply were disinterested. Please be aware and careful.  UBER, you should be ashamed.

review: Uber Eats charged me FULL price for an order I cancelled less than ONE MINUTE of ordering.  Why did I cancel you ask? Because delivery was going to be over an hour even though I'm paying for 20-30 minute delivery.  This is so illogical and illegal!! They charged me $60 because apparently in less than one minute, the restaurant had my order going already.  To top it all off while speaking to god knows who on their chat, I asked to speak with a supervisor or manager because that person wasn't answering my questions and their response was, we all follow the same guidelines. review: Most disgusting company I've ever had to deal with. I am part of Uber one, on two occasions now you've credited my account due to mistakes made by yourself (as your promise to your Uber one customers). The first £5 was credited because items were out of stock and my order was cancelled and the second time was due to the order taking too long so I had £10 in my Uber cash pot. I placed an order and used £5 of this cash towards the order but upon looking at the invoice the £5 wasn't actually credited to the order it was just stolen from my cash pot. I messaged you about it and you relied you have 'decided not to give me the £5 anymore'!!!!!! I've then been to check my account today and it appears the other £5 has now been taken as well. You make promises to your customers when part or Uber one but then decide afterwards you don't want to give them the credit promised? If you didn't want to give it dont make the promise and don't give it. But the fact you've put it into my account and then stolen it back is absolutely disgusting. This will be going to consumer rights and I'll be contacting citizens advice of where I stand with this as in my eyes it's theft of my money you had already given me then decided to take back for no apparent reason or explanation from yourselves. I will be boycotting everything to do with Uber and will not stop until resolved.

Not the first issue I’ve had with Uber eats but this will definitely be the last, awful customer service and awful staff that refuse to do anything when there’s issues with their services they offer.

review: If I could give them a 0 star I would, absolutely shocking customer service from the driver that was tasked to deliver my McDonalds food last night; it's not the first time I have had issues with this company delivery service, but last night takes the mickey. I clearly listed my address and postcode (a residential address, might I add) correctly on my order, (no one else except uber has difficulties with my address), yet the driver's app that he uses sent him to the wrong location. When he called to ask why I was not at the destination to accept my order, I informed him that there was no-one at my house and I asked him where he was. He rudely stated that he was at the steel works entrance (3 and a half miles away from where I live in the middle of an industrial estate). When I explained he was in the wrong area and tried to give him directions he flat out and rudely stated he would not be delivering my order as it is too far out of his way. I had to argue that I had clearly stated my correct address when placing the order and that he should complete the delivery to the correct address as required but he just told me he would not deliver as he would not get paid the extra mileage - how is this my issue? He went to the wrong address, he is at fault, yet he was trying to blame me - He simply told me that he would not deliver and that the order will be cancelled and I should take it up with McDonalds then hung up the phone. So i was left out of pocket (as Uber will take up to 15days to refund me - your customer service line is just as useless when I tried calling them alongside McDonalds by the way), with 2 very hungry children. I will be avoiding the company at all cost in the future -as will everyone I have spoken to who have had similar issues - clearly this company does not care about its customers.

But, gotta be real, a couple of times my order played hide and seek with some missing items or took the scenic route to my place. The app can be a bit wonky too, throwing in a few tech tantrums. Despite those speed bumps, Uber Eats is still my go-to for lazy, delicious meals. If you're into saving time and not stressing over cooking, I'd give them a thumbs up.

review: Well fortunately I actually got the 100 dollar Uber eats card via Caesers Rewards Sportsbook and Casino for the tier level I achieved and that's what will make this review civil as it will be, had I subsequently purchased the card with my hard earned money I would be absolutely beside myself and I would be attacking the company with every single breath in my body for a number of ridiculous reasons but I didn't pay for it with my cash therefore I would be wasting additional time in my life to do anymore than I am , but I feel like I might be able to help someone else who very well might be oblivious to the deceptive value of the Uber Eats Corp  and there criminal like unchanging of already extremely high prices of fast food , and general on the go meals they offer , but I will focus on one single incident and that was the meal I elected at a popular sub restaurant Firehouse Sub l, as I contemplated my first meal purchase it was clearly obvious that the option of purchase and delivery of the meal was a out of the question, so I was forced to utilize the pickup option only to get the shock of my life within the arena of fast food ordering since I was new to this form of ordering I chose to wait and place my order within the establishment because my attempts were stiffled with each way I tried to make the order complete and it seemed as if I was doing something incorrectly because the price was so much more than that of the establishment had I ordered it as I always had with cash so once at Firehouse it became clear that the ordering process would be much more different than I could've ever imagined, but I had paid nothing for the Uber card and yet I found it difficult to continue with the order once I realized that the pizza meatball sub that I love so much had a surcharge amount additional to its original price and for what I have found to be nothing more than a sheer luxury of having a plastic card with the Uber logo upon it because just days earlier I had this exact same meal of sandwich and soda was roughly $17.42 was now costing me $22.47 it was clear that the privilege of having the opportunity to purchase the meal with the stylish and sleek design of the Uber Eats card was just a mere 5 dollars and 5 cent which ultimately was nothing at all seeing that the card in hand made me feel as if I was the late Anthony Bourdain deep within the 🇮🇹 Italy on a dangerous excursion in search of the perfect slices of pepperoni,  even though I was merely deep within the hills and my very own nightmare of the great state of West Virgina on a cols tuesday night , Uber Eats should be ashamed of themselves but i grant you there anything but!!!!! I will never use them in any situation ever!!

review: I can't believe you guys do this here in Portugal! I can't! You offer something for a price (and this should be honoured!), then the next screen says about half portion and full portion, being the full portion more expensive than the offer. Man, if you offer 8 pastéis for 10 euros, it's 8 pastéis for 10 euros! How come you then charge more for 8 pastéis?! The worst is: you don't even mention, on the second screen, how many pastéis are a half partion and how many are the full one! This is totally confusing and misleading.It doesn't exist! It's illegal! How does the government allows that?!What about the fries? You don't even mention how much (quantity, grams) they are. How can you just sell something without clear information? How can I know if I received the correct quantity?! So you just put as little fries as you want??Not to mention the drink, I asked for a Fanta and received a coke. All wrong with this order, what a frustrating experience. And the food was not even good, not for this price.

I just spoke to their customer service and they said they will not honor the 60% off because it has been more than 4 days after the order that I contacted them.  I have contacted them everyday, including the day of the order asking for assistance.  They didn't get back to me until 4 days after the order requesting a picture of the offer.  I responded immediately.  Now they are saying I didn't respond until 4 days later so they can't honor the offer per their policy.  They delayed responding to any of my e-mails.  This is totally fraudulent.  They used a bait and switch tactic.  NEVER TRUST THEM!!  Unscrupulous business practices.  I demanded a supervisor contact me - let's see if that ever happens.

review: After waiting over an hour for food from a restaurant that is a) fast food and 2)less than 10 minute drive from my home, I contacted uber and they refunded my order. The issue I have is the a hole driver who was waiti by at the restaurant where my food was ready for ages, hoping he would get more pick ups from same place. When I contacted him via text, he ignored my question as to when I can expect collection and why a 10-15minute delay was being added to my delivery time that went from 17:50 to 18:35. When i later text back to say ‘you keep delaying my order’ his response was ‘yes’. This thieving sc um knew exactly what he was doing because when I then contacted uber (finally able to get to a human via chat after 10 mins of frustratingly trying) the agent cancelled my order without a fee and at that EXACT moment, my order got collected from the Barnsley peel st KFC. I have no idea if the drivers can track or get notified when you speak to an agent, but its a great coincidence that the moment my order got cancelled he suddenly collects it. I hope he chokes on it and the haram food he steals from customers comes back to find him. I will never use uber eats again ever and have told my family to do same, this incident was on my mums uber account as we were at hers and the kids wanted a treat. Waited and wasted over an hour for a mr selvin or selvan something from barnsley uber eats to steal our order and take the absolute mick. On too of that, when i went back on chat to ask how to make a complaint, uber refused to help me. And the cheek to ask drivers for tips after their extortionate prices, service fees and delivery charges.

So all food was missing from order. Reported to Uber Eats who issued a partial refund of £7.58. Bare in mind the total of the order was £16.14. Therefore they expect me to pay £8.56 for a medium fanta orange, price of £2 on the menu on the Uber Eats app, due to someones mistake. Emailed via the app multiple times with very slight and poor responses. Therefore messaged on facebook, to be told that the partial refund is not eligible for adjustment. Very poor customer service. All i request is my money back for a service that I payed for and was not provided. DO NOT USE UBER EATS!!!! Will be publishing all chat screenshots and evidence to all social medial shortly and have also fraised this as fraudulent activity with my banking provider.

review: Muhammad Shabir delivered our McDonald's order on 9 December 23 in Coventry. Not only was he rude and unprofessional, he did not even bring the order to the door claiming he "did not know the address". The flat number was detailed and I provided notes for the driver to tell him where it was. When he called me, he told me he was outside parking. I said okay, my partner will collect it. Hung up. He calls a few minutes later, must've forgot he called because he was bad mouthing  me saying "I don't know the woman must have fell asleep". He reiterated a few minutes later after I repeatedly said hello that he was outside. I clearly said to him I would send my partner out now to him. He was basically hurrying us up when he had been there nothing short of a few minutes. He told me "speak slowly and kindly to me" otherwise he'd cancel my order. What the actual? When my partner went out to collect, he had said to him that they were on time limits with the deliveries and my partner reiterated that you are paid to bring it to our door, not to the car park.This man was rude. I don't know how he's employed. Never had any problems with UberEats before, drivers find my flat very easily no struggle.

review: I always use Uber eats, I have Uber one and all my friends get their food inspiration from me. For a while I thought I had an Uber eats addiction. HOWEVER, in the last 2-3 weeks I’ve had some serious issues and no direct support… I ordered something the charge was pending on my bank account but the store-the food- the order disappeared from the Uber eats app. Then I ordered something else a week later and the driver brought me someone else’s order! My order was £25 and the order received was worth £10 when I told the driver it wasn’t my order he refused to take the order back and told me to take it up with Uber. I reached out to Uber and they stilllll charged me for the meal I never got!! Not to mention I have dietary restrictions and nothing in the order I could’ve eaten. Now in Uber eats it says my order was £7 but I have screenshots of everything. They’ve scammed me so many times I’m gonna have to write them off and tell everyone I know about this awful experience 2/10 customer service & my issue is still not resolved to date.

review: The Customer Service Team is absolutely shocking, what has happened in the world for the customer experience not to be at the forefront of a company's agenda. As soon as I ordered my meal this morning little did I know the aggro I would get over the next couple of hours, I would rather have gone hungry if I'd have known. Only half of my food arrived, I presumed after calling the team I would either get it sent to me again (wishful thinking) or get a refund. I got a quarter of my refund owed to me. After ringing back due to their mistake, and after speaking to the manager she could not do anything else for me. They had a guideline to follow and that was that and as they had refunded a small amount back they couldnt do anymore. I asked how was a guideline being followed when the majority of my items had not been delivered and also not refunded. The manager should not have this title!So not only did I lose out on food this morning I also lost money. I would never use this company for anything ever again; that is how shocked I feel with regards to their aftercare. They need to re-think their stratagy in what they are hoping to achieve and complete re-training. All I wanted to do this morning was to eat my breakfast, thank you Uber for ruining the one job you had to do, the main reason for your existence; deliver all of my food.

review: I don't know whats going on at the moment with all courier companies for food delivery but it is outrageous. I usually use JE but moved over to UE after awful experiences. The same thing has happened with Uber, I placed an order last night for mcdonalds around 7.20, by 8.45 the order had not even been collected by the courier, i had 4 different drivers assigned and they all cancelled, eventually after a very long wait i got to speak to someone on live chat who cancelled my order and as a 'gesture of goodwill' cancelled the charge (they tried to charge me the full food order to cancel?!) it really is unacceptable, i'm diabetic and i was really needing to eat at this point, almost 9pm and still no food. I had to make a microwave meal in desperation/quickness. They gave me a £5 voucher because my order guarantee time was missed which i've (stupidly) used again this morning on breakfast, thinking, surely, breakfast at 11am is not going to be terribly busy from an independent little shop in town centre, apparently so, i'm still waiting and a driver has not been assigned again (after 3 already cancelling so far) i honestly will never use UE again. estimated delivery time from my order is now 12.45, ridiculous. it's not even the drivers necessarily who are at fault here, something is very very wrong.

review: I received a $20 off promo code in my email. I used it in the app within the time period and it accepted it. Once my order was pushed through and I checked the receipt there was no promo or discount applied at all. I called right away and was instructed to send a screen shot of the promo code from my email to be refunded. I followed up after not hearing back within 48 hours. 4 days later I still had zero response so I called back. I was told there was an issue in their system and the code has been de-activated which is hilarious because the promotion is still being advertised in my app while I type this ...on the phone call I was told that I could not be transfered to a manager or supervisor as non were available since they were all busy helping other users. I offered to wait and said I did not want to get off the phone until I had a refund resolution as I really need the funds back. I was told that the case had to be escalated to a special team and that id hear back in 1-2 days. I've wasted over 3 hours of my time trying to get money back that I am owed. I would have never placed the order if I didn't receive the promo code. UBER EATS SCAMMING PEOPLE. For this 3rd phone call, after being on the phone trying to advocate for myself for over 40 mins I was hung up on by the rep. I cannot contact support via chat in the app or report an issue in the app because anytime I try to it just goes to the help center articles with no other option to contact anyone or submit any issue. I have an android - pixel 6. This is probably the worst customer experience I have ever endured. If you haven't tried Uber eats yet, trust me, don't waste your time and especially money!!!

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars
name: Catherine Taha

review: Had a fraudulent $1.2k order placed on my account from Texas (we live in Canada and have NO relations to Texas), and none of the: 'premium' support, Uber support Twitter account or reaching out directly within the app/site helped. I spent OVER a week reiterating the issue with representatives of their team (new ones every time since they never stay connected to support chats/emails/DMs), and was told every single time that I would either: a) get a report filed to get assistance from their technical support team, b) that someone I knew must have been using my account and that it was a miscommunication, or c) that they looked into the order and came to the conclusion that the purchase was 100% valid. The absolute BEST their customer service did was: offer $15 in credit....I mean, honestly. My family has TWO separate uber one accounts and we will be cancelling all and deleting our accounts. If you're ever concerned about security, and how customer services may help you with it -- they won't. I had better luck with the police and my bank.Let me just say, as a final note, I work as a cloud security engineer at a large company and am in AWE at the blatant disregard for security and issues related to fraud/cybersecurity that Uber seems to have as a whole. I should have known since 2018 (when they finally announced their customer account data was hacked in 2017 -- yes, a whole YEAR later) that they would not change their ways.Please reconsider using any Uber apps.

review: Please do yourself a favour and not use UberEats. I ordered a Costa through them, I was given one inedible incorrect item, one missing item and lastly a coffee with no lid and the contents in the bag it came in. I contacted them straight away for them to only offer a refund of half of what I paid. When I asked them to justify these reasons I was told they would investigate it and get back to me but for now half of it had been processed and would be back in my account in the next few days. 1 month later, I never heard back from them and I also never received my refund. I have since tried chasing my refund to be told because I didn't notify them within 48 hours I am not eligible for a refund though I have receipt proof they told me they were refunding half of it as they already did the admin and adjusted it on my order when I originally contacted them on the day I received my order! I have since heard from them by my constant chasing that they will not be adjusting my refund to the full amount though won't explain their reasons and are also now refusing to refund me what they once stated they would. Honestly one of the worst customer service experience I have had. Whenever this gets resolved, if ever, I will be deleting this app and never using them again.

review: PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE USING UBER EATSHorrific! worst service i have ever received - I placed an order for food (£23) received a happy meal LOL!.  I advised uber that the food did not arrive and submitted a claim for refund.  Never received the refund, contacted uber every day and was ignored every day.  Contacted on social media... ignored!! I received a message today saying unable to refund as over 48 hours DESPITE CONTACTING THEM EVERYDAY SINCE THE DAY OF THE ORDER.SCAM - PLEASE BEWARE.  I'M NOW BEING IGNORED BY LIVE CHAT AND SOCIAL MEDIAWILL BE CONTACTING TRADING STANDARDS AND CITIZENS ADVICE ALONG WITH THEIR REGULATOR!I WOULD GIVE THEM LESS THAN 1* IF I COULD!!!
stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars
name: ST

review: Yesterday, I placed an order via Uber eats for about €15 and asked that the food delivery be received in person. I got a notification that courier was close by and within seconds got another notification with a picture showing that food delivery was kept on the floor of the street, less than 1m to the entrance of a garbage house. I was utterly shocked and immediately rushed to the entrance of my office to see if i could see the courier or the delivery. As expected, the delivery was NOT there.I filed a complaint to the customer service and they fradulently responded that the courier waited for 10 mins before dropping off the food delivery on the floor of the street right next to a garbage house.I demanded for proof of all delivery notifications with time stamps, but they ignored my request and maintained they would NOT issue a refund.This happened in Berlin, Germany,I know there are people who are also victims of the fradulent activities of Uber eats and i intend to pursue a legal action against this company.Anyone with similar experience and evidence of denial of refund from Uber eats should contact me so we can file a class action suit against this fradulent company!
stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: I ordered a McDonalds, the stickers on the burgers put a time stamp of 8.53pm. I was alerted by the app that the driver had picked up the meal at 9pm. I had paid the extortionate price for priority delivery (power cut, food off at home). I then watched the driver make multiple stops around my area and then 35 mins later reach my house. My food as you can imagine was stone cold, no saving it and went straight in the bin. I complained and Ubereats refunded me out of a £16.39 bill only £3.28. I am absolutely disgusted and fuming.So in return i spoke to one of the drivers to find out what is going on, why is uber eats failing customers and then not refunding them.The driver told me that Ubereats does not pay a wage people can live on and the place to be is actually Deliveroo, who provide a proper wage. Obviously you are going to deliver the food you get the best pay on first. Since deleting my Uber eats app and changing service, i have had zero issues. I was shocked at the turn around of service. The biggest surprise was also the cost, so much cheaper. Not multiple service charges like uber eats calculating £4-6, before the delivery fee is then added. I still want the rest of my refund! But i am now saving so much money and enjoying hot food via another service. So will never have to deal with this company again.

review: This is the worst customer support and service experience ive had in recent memory. We wasted 2 hours waiting for food (that was never going to come!) and about 20-40 minutes trying to reach an honestly inexcusably bad customer service. All while in between we were being assured that our order is coming and the uber driver changed so we had to wait just a bit longer! Turns out the store was not even open!!! We ordered food from a store that was closed for the day and they kept telling us the order is waiting to be picked up!!! Forgetting about that, imagine that someone does not have enough money to place a new order. The representative did not even give me time to react as he/she proceeded to refund in 3-5 days. Never even asking if that would be okay or giving any other option such as "add it to my wallet" so that someone without more money can order straight away. But i guess they don't care if you cant afford another order and cant feed your guests!". Later I'm met with this cold apathy where the customer service representative doesn't even allow me to get a word in edgewise and proceeds to quickly try and make an excuse in the end that obviously was a lie (since the store told methey were not even open at the time). I had a friend over from abroad that day and we wasted our evening waiting on food to start a movie and hearing excuses and frankly a refusal to communicate by both the store (who again, turned out to be closed) and Uber. Upon 2 more contacts (no live chat available) I received 2 half assed apathetic appologies each 48 hours later. Not even a coupon or something lol. They will ruin your hangout and wont even care :)

review: Horrendous service. We'd not had a knock at the door and it was 20 mins late so I went to ring up to ask what was happening and saw a text saying it had been delivered. When I went in to the app it showed a pic of a McD's bag next to our shed in the garden. I went and retrieved it from the far end of our back garden. So the lad had walked through our gate into the back garden and rather than walk the further 15 paces or so to the house door they just left it there next to some rubble and breezeblocks. I rang to get a refund and the lad said he couldn't give a refund because it had been delivered on time! Even though he'd not gone anywhere near our house (the place he actually was meant to deliver it to!) and the delivery hadn't been done he said he was unable to refund because if its on time then that makes it fine! He didn't seem to want to allow me to take it further as after 3 times of asking he'd still not told me what the complaints process was and/or how we could discuss this with a manager (at McD's or Uber Eats). I've had loads of deliverys with them before but neither our family or any of our close friends/family will be ordering from them again. The worst thing is I tipped them before the delivery on the app, what a mug! If I could I've have given 0/5 as this was not worthy of a point and their response to my phone call about the delivery makes them even worse. Well they're now going to miss out on a lot of money though being out of order because I'm letting everyone know how poor this is and never to order from Uber Eats.

Looking inside the app and emails no order numbers for the 3 orders I stated that to them numerous times and got the same copy paste answer asking for it . I have had more luck in getting my 5 year old to listen then getting anywhere with Uber support. I then stated I was closing my account and removing the Uber one. They then miraculously found my orders without an order number and offered me a 3 pound voucher for my troubles. By this time al the local grocery places was closed so I told them to close my account as this was unacceptable. They then told me to check on google on how to close my account. Totally unacceptable from Uber eats

review: I tried to do something nice for a friend. She was going through a rough time in her life so I wanted to surprise her with groceries. She lives with her grandmother. Her grandmother, didn’t know the order was coming. I received a notification on my phone The Uber driver clicked “delivered” on the ap. I thought the food was delivered. I called the grandma later to check up on the order to ensure she received it and that raccoons didn’t and she said she didn’t accept it. Once the Uber driver came to the door the grandma declined the order because she didn’t know they were meant for her and she didn’t want to take someone else’s food. I called Walmart, they said the food was not returned. The Uber chat was useless to say the least. I contacted them, the customer service rep said there’s no refund and nothing that can be done. I said let me talk to a manager. She said sure I can do that but they’re going to give you the same information I am. I said, so it’s a dead end solution you’re giving me? And she responded yes. She said the Uber driver can take the food if declined and told me to read under the terms and use of Uber eats. I said this can’t possibly be what’s written under Uber eats terms? Management later called me and said the same thing. Useless and not helpful. They said the driver tried to contact me. I said there are no missed callsOn my end. They said they had record of the contact being made. I asked for those records. They said that option is not available. I asked to speak to a higher up. They said that option is not available. $98 down the drain. Uber Eats is the leading brand in deliveries. They know this. They knowinglytake advantage and abuse there power. This is middle class people who they’re knowingly taking advantage off. They have a major surplus of customers. They don’t care about keeping customers. That was made apparent to me. They made me feel dumb. They were NOT helpful. No refund was provided. The groceries never made it to my friend. They said everything was done on there end correctly and made me feel stupid for trying to do something kind. The app has been deleted.

review: I will never use Uber eats again. The company are scammers.They use the pending method to scam customers. It is an I.T glitch which they are taking advantage of to fraud customers and gaining double payments for the one transaction. My account was debited on day of transaction which went into pending on my mobile banking app! That reflected on my balance on that day for the goods. Then 5 days later my balance decreases again for the exact same amount. I contacted my bank and they advised me that only one payment has gone out to Uber eats however my remaining balance monies does not reflect that. Please be aware this is a loophole in the system an It glitch which they have cottoned onto Uber eats are fraudulently taking extra money from their customers without their knowledge and without their consent. I will never use the company again and I strongly recommend that no one else should unless they want to fall prey like me and be double charged for the same items. Absolute con company no wonder they are such a wealthy organisation when they are pulling stunts like this.One extremely unhappy customer

review: The service is terrible! I have had a number of small issues, but the one that tipped me over the edge was yesterday. Me and my wife had our first child and needed to order some essentials. I placed the order and was informed it would be here within 30 mins. Roughly an hour later, nothing. Called the shop where my order was being collected, they stated the delivery person attempted to call and deliver but bought the shopping back. So I call Uber eats customer service line to be informed that the driver tried contacting me and waited 7 minutes for me. This is not true at all!! I have no missed calls on my mobile device or voice messages. No one pulled up outside our house or knocked! So I had to leave my wife who was still recovering from the birth with our little one and get the essentials. Awful service, awful customer service. This needs to be addressed if they want to keep running. I will not be using this service again and recommend others don’t either.

review: Uber Eats ￼ Can we talk about how poor Uber eats customer service really is on Friday Dec 1. I ordered from Wingstop and immediately contacted them to cancel my order because I got a call from my sister saying that my mom has had a heart attack so I went to cancel it so I can go to her. The first thing I tried to do was just to cancel it in general, but I had to use the chat bot thing in order to do that, so it asked me what are the reasons why that I am canceling my order and I said that I ordered it by mistake because we didn’t really have an option for saying that you had a family emergency so I just put it as a mistake, but it wouldn’t take it and the app kept bugging like it was delaying everything so I just ended up asking for a representative to speak to, an actual person they contacted me with was Nanci. Mind you before Nanci even got on the chat. It took an incredibly long time, maybe five minutes before I even got in contact with her and then as I was talking to her explaining as to why I went to cancel my order her replies took at least 2 to 4 minutes now I worked customer service for a very long time and I know how to cancel orders it doesn’t take 2 to 3 minutes or 2 to 4 minutes to get on the chat and be like hey I can totally do that for you. It doesn’t take that long so then after I dealt with her and got fed up with Her, she referred me to some team that could further help me but that team response would’ve took 6 to 12 hours. Why would it take 6 to 12 hours for them to cancel our order? By the time that it would take 6 to 12 hours my order would already be there and I wouldn’t be home, so I called customer service they weren’t any better. I called them and they had me on hold for 11 to probably 18 minutes and then I got in contact with Nel or Mel I can’t remember which one but it was one of those two and she put me on hold probably like two or three times and was saying how they can’t give they can’t cancel my order because the food was already in route. But if they would’ve canceled it from the gecko, the food would not have been in route, so they purposely delayed and stalled in order for my food to go out so they wouldn’t have to cancel so they could still get money. So then I asked her if I could speak to her supervisor and she replied how they would say the exact same thing to me as she did and how they wouldn’t be able to get in contact in contact with me for at least 24 hours so then I asked her for her employee ID number, she said they’re not allowed to give those out. I think asked for her last name and she wouldn’t give me it either. Then I heard back from another lady I can’t remember her name but I do have screenshots of everything so I will be inserting that into the post but she  contacted me and said that she saw that my food has already been delivered and there’s nothing else they can do.they purposely stall you so they don’t have to cancel it so we don’t have to get money back and they want your money. They don’t care if your food is on the way or not I highly highly highly suggest not ordering from them no more unless you want to get scammed constantly.Again please don’t order from them! They’re horrible and only want your money! They don’t care about customers service at all! Please spread the word!

Will not be using them or anyone associated with them again, that's for sure. *Update* driver has now blocked my number, I phoned back to say to him to send me a message to confirm he cancelled it because he told me on the phonecall. review: As the title says, do NOT save your credit card or other payment option in this app.I'm from Spain, somebody got into my account and ordered a 1499$ worth MacBook in San Antonio TX, US in a CostCo.Uber eats didn't ask for any confirmation SMS code or anything. I just realised that this happened because I got an alert from my bank that this movement was charged on my card.I managed to install the app and cancel it on time, so I was lucky.In any case, I think that if all my orders are below 50€ in Spain and you receive an order of 1499$ in the US, this should have raised some alert in Uber eats and should have blocked it out at least asked for some SMS code or similar.Since I managed to cancel it I tried to contact the support team and they didn't reply for one week, and now that they answered, they didn't even read the comments, just replied that they don't see that amount charged... When I already explained that was cancelled on time.From a serious company I would have expect some promise to improve the security, maybe some apologies and even try to find who made this order, as that lesson had to enter a physical address for the delivery.To sum up, beware of keeping any payment method on this app

review: The level of sheer incompetence of this company is overwhelming. I ordered mcdonalds through uber eats and mcdonalds failed to comply with additions to burgers which were paid for and also just failed to even add a burger into my order. The food arrived cold. I advised Ubereats that despite the food being cold my issue was one the special request and the missing burger and request a refund of these. They responded and advised no refund was forthcoming because apparently I had had adjustments in my orders before. I advised them I tend to order from mcdonalds and their level of incompetence is matched by ubereats, ergo, there were issues with previous orders. Please let me point out happy to pay for what i receive even if it is cold. Not happy to pay for items not received cause I didn’t receive them. Sounds like fraud. Complained many a time, requested information on their complaints procedure and also their regulatory body and was shut down. In a nutshell, uber eats represents the companies with whom they are partnered to. If mcdonalds does not fulfil my order correctly then I request a refund from ubereats. Ubereats seems to think that they can get away charging for items not received. Shocking. Actually morally disgusting really. You can’t even get past their low level rubbish customer service to anyone with a slightly larger brain who can better assist. I shall report them to the ICO for failure to comply with my request.

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars
name: Shelley Chadwick

review: I used to order food often from Uber Eats. It was by far my most used app for food in general. Today they lost themselves a customer.Not only the platform is extremely unreliable and inaccurate on its estimates (ETAs) — which means your 20 min order easily becomes 1h — but trying to solve an issue with your order is nearly impossible.Customer support is nonexistent. Whatever they call a “help centre” takes ages to respond, which means there’s no addressing an ongoing or recent order. If you’re lucky enough to get a response, they’ll simply automatically apply whatever solution sounds best for their business rather than for the customer, therefore simply ignoring the problem itself and dismissing your concerns. My order was ridiculously wrong, which I realised as soon as I entered my apartment. I tried reaching out and it took them almost a full day to get back to me. So there was no returning the order, no getting a new order or ordering something else. No option. The only thing I had was a “wait for our response”, which in turn came through an automated solution that I did not agree to. But here’s the catch: even if you don’t agree to the solution, they’ll just go ahead and do it anyway because they don’t care what you think. After that, good luck trying to get anything else done. The case is closed. And so is my account now.

review: What went wrong every time!! I ordered KFC through Uber eats for the first time in 12 months (I’d had the same issues previously). My £42 order arrived missing items which I reported to Uber eats to be told ‘You’ve had to much of your money back recently for missing items, so I was not entitled to it now. Just review the vendor.’ I was unhappy with this, so I wrote about it on my Facebook page, tagging Uber eats, they promptly reported my post saying I had tried to get money or goods through committing fraud and deception. Clearly trying to cover their complete lack of customer awareness and service. I have proof that I haven’t ordered in 12 months, so their reply of I had to much money back recently clearly isn’t true. So I wrote about them reporting me, they reported that post too. Not allowing your customers to get refunds when they haven’t received the goods they paid for is bad, bad practice. Lying about customers is just plain stupid. So needless to say I don’t rate Uber eats and have promoting re-deleted the app (also have asked Facebook to review my posts properly).
