review: I am compelled to share my horrendous experience with Uber Eats, and the lack of customer support has left me utterly frustrated.I recently placed an order through Uber Eats, and to my dismay, the food never arrived. The order mysteriously vanished from my 'past orders' on the app, leaving me in a state of confusion. Desperate for assistance, I embarked on a futile journey to seek support.I tried reaching out through three different phone numbers, three email addresses, and even attempted to navigate the unhelpful website and app. Unfortunately, none of these avenues provided the assistance I needed. The app couldn't locate my order, and every time I managed to connect with a human, I was transferred to a different department, only to have the line abruptly disconnect.Feeling exasperated and out of options, I resorted to creating a Twitter account just to seek support. It is disheartening that I had to resort to such measures to address a simple issue with my order.The most frustrating part of this ordeal is the apparent intentional difficulty Uber imposes on customers seeking a refund. The lack of a streamlined support system and the constant runaround from one department to another is unacceptable.Uber Eats needs to seriously reevaluate its customer support infrastructure to ensure that customers can easily and efficiently resolve issues. No one should have to jump through such hoops just to address a missing order and seek a refund.I sincerely hope Uber Eats takes notice of this review and implements improvements in their customer support system. As it stands, my experience has been nothing short of a nightmare, and I caution others to be wary of relying on Uber Eats for their food deliveries.

review: I am writing this complaint review to express my extreme frustration with the difficulty I encountered while trying to reach Uber's customer service. As a loyal customer, I expected a smooth and efficient process, but unfortunately, my recent experience left me feeling incredibly dissatisfied.Firstly, it took an unreasonable amount of time and effort to even get through to a representative. The long wait times and constant automated messages only added to my frustration. When I finally connected with a customer service agent, the language barrier became immediately apparent. The representative I spoke to did not have a strong command of English, which made it incredibly challenging to communicate my issue effectively.The most frustrating part of the conversation was when I had to provide my email address. Despite spelling it out phonetically multiple times, the representative seemed unable to comprehend or accurately record the information. I had to repeat my email address over seven times, which was not only time-consuming but also incredibly inefficient.Furthermore, I am deeply disappointed with Uber's refusal to refund my order. The food I received was stone cold, likely due to being delivered on a bicycle in freezing temperatures. This not only compromised the quality of the meal but also posed a potential health risk.As a customer, I expect to be treated with respect and to receive assistance from knowledgeable representatives who can understand and address my concerns effectively. Unfortunately, this experience with Uber's customer service fell far short of my expectations.I hope that Uber takes this feedback seriously and takes steps to improve their customer service and refund policy. It is essential for a company of their stature to provide efficient and effective support to their customers, especially when issues like food quality and delivery conditions arise.

I dont mind a scooter or even a car which it normally comes in I'd wait extra time for it but a bicycle is unacceptable.I can not trust uber eats now because if they got riders on bicycles in the freezing cold I'd rather not order from them.I have no issues with rider he was trying to do his job but its unacceptable coming after 2 hours on a bicycle, a person has family obligations, work obligations etc and if riders are coming on bicycles for uber we'll I'm done using uber.

review: If the order is processed as expected and you get your food, great. If things go wrong be prepared to say goodbye to your payment and/or your food. The customer service is non-existent with Uber eats. They make it very difficult to resolve any issues - the agent will stick to a script regardless. The restaurant called me to say they didn't have the item I had ordered. They offered me the choice to order something else or request a refund via Uber eats. I opted for a refund. Mistake. Uber eats refused to engage with me. So be prepared to lose your money if the restaurant doesn't have what you order. The app is deliberately set up to minimise any customer service contact that you can have with them. Each time I sent a message and got a minimal response, I was requested to rate the response but it disappeared when I clicked on it. Possibility that the agent did this to avoid low scores. Avoid at all costs. Just Eat has better scores.

If sending a photo, please send a single image containing all items delivered and the order receipt.Thank you for your understanding.Now following this the next day we contacted the store and they honoured our order and provided us the food the following day which was very nice of them to do so but Ubereats, pick your game up. Very very poor customer service.

When I finally got a hold of him he stated I had to get a refund from Uber eats as that’s who I paid and they would go to the restaurant. I then started contacting them and they didn’t want to refund my order. They only refunded me part of what was missing and then told me I was past the refund time. I explained I was in contact with the restaurant at first as I thought they were who messed up my order but then I did contact Uber eats. And if I was past the refund time why did they refund $12 of the $50 order then. That was an insult. I won’t use Uber eats again. Not a reputable company at all.

Despite my attempts to assist through phone calls and in-app messaging, she left without delivering our meal. To add insult to injury, when I cancelled the order due to this confusion, Uber Eats retained my payment instead of issuing a refund. My efforts to explain the situation fell on deaf ears as their customer service showed a complete lack of empathy and understanding. This experience not only left us without dinner but unfairly out of pocket too. I am extremely disappointed and will think twice before using Uber Eats again.

review: I recently placed an order with Amigos Feltham through Uber Eats, and unfortunately, my experience was quite disappointing. The delivery was not only extremely late but also arrived cold, prompting me to have to use the microwave to heat up my food. To add to the frustration, the milkshake included in the order had spilled inside the bag.Upon contacting Uber and providing photographic evidence of the issues, the response I received was less than satisfactory: "We will be unable to provide a refund on this occasion. We understand that these issues do arise on occasion, but not often at this regularity."I'm puzzled by the term "regularity" used here, and frankly, I don't comprehend Uber's decision. In a highly competitive food delivery industry where numerous alternatives exist, it's essential for platforms to prioritize customer satisfaction. If this is the level of service and understanding offered by Uber, it's crucial for them to recognize that customers wield significant influence. Our choices as consumers shape the success of platforms, and when service falls short, we have the power to choose alternatives that prioritize our experience. The competitive landscape is vast, and as customers, we should expect and demand better.For the record Amigos is amazing and will not lose my custom. I cant say the same for Uber Eats.

In addition to dealing this frustration, the company decided to enforce a policy that they would not refund us for the missing food (likely an assumption that we were being dishonest). Rather than solving a delivery problem, they have chosen to force us to pay for food that wasn’t received. Not the kind of company we want to do business with.

Additional $40 was just gone. This never happened before. I was told this was a standard practice??? My money was back in my account 24 hour later, but it was a great inconvenience. Be aware.

review: Uber eats has to be using AI as their support. I won’t believe otherwise! A few weeks ago, Uber suspended all of my promo codes. I chatted in asking what happened and the agent sent a generic copy and paste message telling me “you’ve breached our terms and can no longer use promo codes”. I was baffled as I wasn’t aware of doing something wrong. I order as normal, use promo codes when they are available, haven’t asked for a refund on anything but a 50cent sauce in probably 6 months or more, and haven’t really had any issues in general. I was a bit confused by this statement. I asked the agent what term I’ve breached and he ended the chat. I chatted back in, asked the agent what term I’ve breached, and he copied and pasted the exact message the first agent pasted, stating I’ve breached a term. Yes… I know… I asked him a second time, which term I breached. He told me due to their privacy laws, he cannot tell me. I asked him what I can do to rectify the situation. He ended the chat. Third time chatting back in. Asked how I can resolve the issue, and if not can Uber close my account. The agent transferred my chat to a specialist who said they would respond within 6-12 hours. Specialist emails me with the same generic “you’ve breached our term” copy paste message as the first two agents. Are you kidding me? I email back asking for my subscription to be cancelled and account to be closed. A new specialist reply’s to me saying “I’m sorry you weren’t able to apply a coupon to your pizza order from 1 month ago. Next time please reach out right away. I can’t give you any refund on the pizza. I’m glad I could resolve this for you.” Is this a joke? Is there a live human on the other end? I can’t believe they are in business.

review: I recently had a frustrating experience with UberEats that I feel compelled to share. I placed an order for groceries, including 2 pieces of chicken, beef mince, and 2 pounds of beef. However, when my order arrived, I noticed that there was 1 pound of beef missing.Naturally, I contacted UberEats customer support to request a re-delivery of the missing item. To my dismay, the customer support representative informed me that they would not be able to provide a refund or any kind of compensation for the missing beef. This was incredibly frustrating, as I had paid for the full order and expected to receive it in its entirety.To make matters worse, I had included special instructions with my order, but it seemed that the store did not bother to follow them. This left me feeling disappointed and dissatisfied with UberEats' customer support and the overall experience.I believe that when customers place orders and pay for specific items, they should receive exactly what they paid for, and if there are any issues, they should be resolved promptly and fairly. Unfortunately, my experience with UberEats fell far short of these expectations, and I am left feeling frustrated and let down by their customer support.

review: We order through UberEats a lot because Deliveroo is not available in our area. On a regular basis items are missing, completely inedible, or spilled/damaged. Given my experience with UberEats customer service in the past, I don't even bother claiming inedible food anymore and I just deal with it. Missing items, however, is a different story.We order at least a few times a week - sometimes small items like coffees, other times meals. Regularly a few companies (mainly McDonalds and Starbucks) do not send items. I claim them back in the app, and up until a month ago I was refunded for these items. In the last month every order I make requires a PIN, and when I tried to claim back a simple £2.39 donut that was not in the bag, I was unable to. Customer support then told me that "we have seen that a number of orders have received price adjustments or credits" and refused to refund me.Yes, indeed, because they were legitimately missing items. I reached out to their customer support again and again and just get a canned response over and over. No refund, despite them taking money for an item. I feel like I'm being treated as a fraudster when I regularly put up with cancelling drivers, lackluster delivery service, delayed service, and missing or terrible items.We never get any compensation for a bad driver, or a driver who is clearly picking up other orders despite our order being ready. However whenever we have a problem there's radio silence and it's somehow our fault.This is basically theft. How can I prove in a photo something is missing? Shall I take a photo of an empty countertop or an empty hand or bag? Given the amount of orders and money spent, the maths works out that I'd have a higher number of claims. Maybe UberEats needs to look at investigating restaurants which can't seem to fulfill orders or properly update their system when sending the order out that an item was missing, instead of spending time calling customers liars.If UberEats doesn't like providing legitimate refunds, and doesn't want to have decent customer support because they're in what they feel is a high fraud business, then maybe they need to rethink their business altogether.

review: I have been an Uber Eats customer for a couple of years and have enjoyed the discount promotion and convenience. Uber Eats was great until you need to contact their customer service.  They will have the same response over and over again, and you need to repeat your issue over and over again.A few weeks ago I got an error message when I tried to activate a promotion offer, I contacted Uber Eats help line and was told that my account was restricted from using promotion because I violate their terms and conditions. I had no idea what I did wrong and none of them were able to tell me.  After about a dozen of calls and emails, someone from their priority support team was able to fix it temporary. It went well for a week and then my account was restricted from using promotion again.  After back and forth a few times, I kept getting the same response that system put a restriction to apply promotion because there is a breach of Uber Eats terms and conditions. Again they couldn't find anything to show that I have done anything wrong. I asked for the priority support team and was told there's no such team!!  Finally I got to speak with a Uber manager and was told that they will do an investigation. I asked if someone will get back to me when the investigation is completed. She said no but I can call to follow up. She said they will close my ticket as nothing more they can do. They reassure me that I can still order but without any promotion for the time being.  I was shocked to find that they said they will investigate but will not get back to the customer

review: I used UberEats for the first the other night. I ordered fast food from Chipotle & paid extra for promptness...the delivery went smoothly & all was well. Because it went so smoothly I decided to order dessert through UberEats... this time the experience made me never want to try again. The driver messaged me that he picked up my order but it was the wrong order & then asked for my code to close out the delivery because he wasn't able to remove it & close it without my code. Well, I said no. I had been charged for the dessert, delivery, & tip & wasn't going to receive what I purchased. After dealing with his many messages & excuse that he didn't speak English & watching the app continue to push my delivery time out (as if he was coming which I knew he wasn't because he said & I was watching him drive other places on the map) I continued to battle your chat bot that wouldn't allow me to do anything as your system still thought it was coming & so I didn't click to cancel for fear that I would be blamed & charged & never get my purchase or a refund. Eventually something in your Chatbot changed (.5hrs later) & I was allowed to chat with a human who said they would cancel the order & I would receive full refund. Thankfully, after eating 45 min of my time on a dessert i never got I did receive a full refund.i do not see myself trying your service ever again. Give 2 stars because it went well first time & I did eventually receive refund,  but not until after I battled chatbot for 45 minutes.

review: Today I received the worst customer service ever. I ordered items from Macdonalds app and they referred me to Uber Eats(who should deliver my order). Address and all the details was correct and I choose the option”hand to me”. When I saw on order tracking that driver was near my flat, the driver called me and asked where am I and that he is waiting for me near traffic lights on the main road. I explained the address to him once again and he started screaming at me. He was screaming and talking rude to me. In conclusion, I just went outside to find him, I was walking all along the road but couldn’t find him. He called me again and continued screaming at me, I told him to cancel my order and request a refund. But he just marked this order as delivered and disappeared. After that I was calling to Uber Eats customer support and told them all what happened, as a result they just said they can’t give me a refund because it was an order from Macdonalds and the fact that Uber Eats cooperated with them to deliver my order can’t make any change to it. So be careful and if your drivers name is Ganiu Mobolaji Y. leave a complaint on him. He’s extremely rude and unsuitable to provide a good customer service.

review: UberEats has just been great overall. Actually, since I started using UberEats, I completely stopped using DoorDash. Part of it is that I have the UberOne membership, and another is that they seem to offer more deals toward purchases. The overall service I get is also a lot better. For example, my orders are most often brought directly to my door (even though I live on the 4th floor), and this NEVER happened with DoorDash. Regardless of delivery instructions, Doordash would often call when they were approaching and request that I come downstairs to meet them. UberEats typically only calls if they're having trouble locating my address (which has only happened once) and they always follow my delivery instructions. I know this review wasn't really intended to be a comparison, but I provided one anyway...🤣

The staff member at the store took our order number down incorrectly on 4 occasions & claimed that he couldn't find it.....yet a manager was shouting in the background, telling him to say that cos "we ain't f-ing cooking it again". We finally got the order after 98 minutes & of course it was all freezing cold, Mcflurries & milkshakes melted. We rang Uber Eats & were told we'd immediately get a refund & it could take 15 days to show in the account. Fast forward to now & still no refund and when we ring in to complain, we are told it is not an Uber Eats problem or to ring McDonald's cos its their fault or they can't understand us.......and they refuse to put a manager on the phone or even put a request in for one to call back. review: If I could give zero stars, I would. I order for my organization all the time from various companies, and this is by far the worst. Never again. Most recent disappointment: I placed an order for pick up on a later date. When I checked the app the morning of my order, there was nothing there. I called the restaurant; nothing in their system. So I had to pivot quickly to feed my team. Three weeks later, Uber Eats charged me the full amount of the order that did not exist in the app. There was no email confirmation after thinking I completed the order days in advance of pick up, so I figured I missed a step and didn't complete it in the first place. I spoke with 4 reps today, all of whom sited a 48 hour policy to contact them. But why would I bother if there was no record of an order, on my end or with the restaurant? Complete scam, bunch of crooks. Never again.

review: I made my order to Greggs at 4pm - 2 lots of sausage roll and hot drinks and 2 bags of crisps. A driver was assigned about 5 mins later.I then watched the driver stop at 3 other restaurants over a 45-minute period, before he eventually cancelled as my driver. It took approx 10 mins for them to find a new driver, during which time I was trying to cancel my order or change it to pick-up. I couldn’t do this as Greggs had accepted the order.I then manager to find a chatbot, which confirmed that I couldn’t cancel the order because it had been prepared by the restaurant, and that I’d be charged full price if I cancelled. So I didn’t cancel. The food arrived at 5.40pm. One of the meals was completely left out and, of course, what was delivered was stone cold due to it having been prepared over an hour earlier. Ubereats refunded for the one meal, but nothing for lateness, coldness or downright negligence.App is about to be deleted - waiting for a food delivery from Uber is just more stressful than it’s worth.

review: Absolutely shocking customer service!Ordered from the McDonald’s app, driver was about 30 mins away from the restaurant and took him about 1hr to pick up order, called up to ask what was happening and if I could cancel, man on phone said food was now on way so couldn’t cancel and said to call back if any problems with the order. Food arrived freezing cold way to cold to eat, Icecream melted that it was now just pure milk, drink spilt everywhere all over straws and other drink, had to bin the food as it was the disgusting and cold that if was to eat probably would of gotten ill! Called Uber eats back up like the man said to do, first women couldn’t find any of my information as she was obviously typing in wrong even though she told us they we were the ones saying it wrong? (It’s my details I can’t say it wrong) called back to find someone else second women found me and put me on hold for 10 minutes to then come back and tell me that they aren’t going to refund, no partial refund, no credit nothing. For food that was inedible? I told the women that is it ridiculous and she told me she understood, she obviously didn’t understand as I would of had a refund, I then asked to speak to a manager he then said they only do refunds if I cancelled the order before restaurant accepts?! Like what the hell? I told him I called up before to cancel due to waiting and then couldn’t as it was then on its way, he said the same thing over and over which was just complete bloody rubbish. So next time if I order of Uber eats and my food is cold I must remember to order and then cancel before I get my food because of course I will no what my food is going to be like, bloody ridiculous. No customer service, they don’t care for anything except for everyone’s money they are scamming. Don’t use, use Deliveroo instead. I am going to try and take it further through my bank.

I also called the restaurant direct and they haven't helped either...I will never be using the app again after years of loyalty.

Our order was cancelled because the driver claimed he tried to contact us and waited out side for over 7 minutes and we didn't contact him. This is utter lies. He was not there when I went outside. He would not answer his phone and the tracker showed him to be no where near our house. He didn't ring the door bell or knock at the door or call me. Uber eats have charged us and will not engage. They keep saying the driver waited even though I have told them I have proof he didn't. They have also tried to say my address was wrong but that is also lies.  I will be contacting my bank to stop payment as this is little more than fraud . Avoid at all costs. I have had issues before but this is the worst experience.  I believe the driver stole our food and Uber Eats is making us pay for it.

review: UberEats is the WORST delivery service in the UK. Highly recommended using Deliveroo or JustEat as their customer service is fair when things go wrong. UberEats just sends automated message after automated message, regardless of the situation. Don't waste your money or your time with them, but if you already have and aren't getting what you need - I recommend doing a chargeback through your bank to get your money back. Delete the app! I ordered food, restaurant began preparing it, driver was assigned, driver was cancelled, yet I received the stone cold food almost an hour later despite the PROMISE TIME being 32 minutes prior to its arrival. It went straight in the bin, disgusting. But the "customer service" was the worst part of the whole experience. They keep offering 40% off codes because they are desperate - on its way out of the UK hopefully! We don't need it.

review: Don't do it. You can't review restaurants - even though you see some reviews listed - they are usually just good ones. There is no way to write one of your own, so I don't know where they get the ones you see. Nor is there any way listed to contact Uber customer service, even though I belong to Uber One. You seem to have to go through their twitter page, and I'm not joining that mess just to contact them. You shouldn't have to search all over the place to find a way to contact them, it should be right on the app page and easy to find. It's a rip-off and a joke. Most of my orders come botched. Even when rating a restaurant with the thumbs up or down, they really don't let you give an accounting of why you're giving a thumbs down, they just give a few suggestions from which to choose. The prices are way too high, restaurants have really taken advantage of pandemic pricing, it's gross. Even though I realize Uber doesn't set the prices, the service itself is so crappy it's not worth joining. They are uninterested in whether you have a good experience, and since that is the essence of customer service, I highly recommend you stay clear.

review: If I could leave a zero I would, my services has been unacceptable both times and I will never use them again Ever! My first order was Wednesday November 8th after having a long day at work I planned to have dinner delivered to my home just in time from returning from picking up the baby from daycare. Only to have two people assigned to my order then it be cancelled at the last minute and thats after 30 minutes has past. I get an email saying my order was cancelled and I would have to reorder for another driver to be assigned.  Yes I was refunded but that’s not the point I work all day and preplan to not cook, I expect my delivery on time. The reorder was great, I ended up with a great driver but this app definitely need some readjustments or something. I gave the benefit of doubt so I ordered again today November 11th from Church’s Chicken and on the app it showed my delivery person to be on a bicycle 😏. I live about 15 minutes away across town, I knew that was getting cancelled and it did. And I did not try to reorder because I’m done! Just over it!

I made the order on my way home, if I didn’t add a new address why would you add a new address on your own. Make your app ask if this is the correct delivery address before it processes. Such a simple task. Lost over $100 because I didn’t have time to cook for my family tonight. Thank you!

review: Im submitting as this rubbish has occurred more than once in a short space of time and refuse to accept this as coincidence. See screenshots of my most recent abysmal experience. I order some food from Burger King via Uber eats app. Around 40 minutes later the rider calls me and says “the restaurant says they dont have your order” at which point I’m asking “what does that mean for me and what are expecting me to do about it since I don’t work for your company” he then says “one second” and hangs up… below is a transcript of the bizzarre ordeal with customer service…this is how uber eats treats customers, so god knows how their employees are treated. 2 hours later I have a deliveroo order instead. This is not the first time this sort of horrendous customer treatment has happened from uber eats so I assume there are real problems with this whole operation. I urge all to submit their terrible experiences unless we are all growing tolerant of the execs of these big companies treating the public like this whilst laughing all the way to the bank.Advisor 1: Hi (my name)Me: Your driver has contacted me saying that the restaurant i ordered from dont have my orderI have already waited far too longI need you to find out from this restaurant what they are doingAdvisor 1: I'm sorry to hear about your issue. Please bear with me for a few minutes while I pull up the details for you.Me: ThanksAdvisor 1: Thanks for waiting. I'm going to try contact the restaurant partner and will get back to you in two minutesMe: Ok thanksAdvisor 1: I am still trying to connect, I hope to update you in the next 2 minutes.Advisor 1: I have tried contacting the restaurant partner but unfortunately, I am unable to get in touch with them.Advisor 1: I've gone ahead and cancelled this order. Rest assured you were not charged for this order.Advisor 1: Is there anything else I can help you with?Me: Did you contact your delivery employee?Me: Hello?Advisor 1: I confirm that your order has been canceled and you are not charged for if.Thank you for your understanding and for reaching out to support. Have a nice day ahead.Me: You didnt answer my questionCHAT ENDED BY ADVISOR 1(Notice the answer avoided so out of sheer frustration i tried again with a different one…) Advisor 2: I can see that the order is mark as cancelled and you're not charged for it.Me: Hi, one of your employees cancelled my order and I did bot ask for thatMe: I only wanted to know what has happened?Me: Nowhere in my messages did I say i wanted to cancel my order. I said that your delivery guy called me saying that burger king dodnt have my orderMe: I saw a message saying the order was with the rider, so did you check that the rider managed to get the order in the end?Advisor 2: I understand that this has been inconvenient and that you were not hoping for this outcome, but I appreciate you letting us know about this.Advisor 2: I understand that this has not been a great experience, but please know that this is not a regular occurrence and I hope your next experience would be a better one.Advisor 2: You can place a new order now.Me: All I want is an answer to my question. What has happened please?Me: Its important for companies to be transparent with customers. So it is reasonable for you to explain what has happened…Advisor 2: Your order was cancelled by one of our agent without asking from you.Advisor 2: This was indeed not the type of experience we strive for, but there can be unusual situations like these which are contrary to the expectations.Me: I know that, but did the rider actually manage to get my order?Me: Can you find out please?Advisor 2: I understand that this is not the outcome you were hoping for. Unfortunately, I am unable to look into this matter any further.Thank you for reaching out to support. Have a nice day ahead.CHAT ENDED BY ADVISOR 2Advisor 3: Hi (my name)Me: This whole chain is going to be posted publicly unless I get an answer to my questionAdvisor 3: Sorry to hear about thatAdvisor 3: I can see your order has been already marked as canceled nad you will be not charged for this order.Me: This is ridiculousAdvisor 2: Rest assured there is no charge for the order, But if you do see any charge right now than please know that the charge you are seeing is likely an authorization hold and will release back to your account shortly.Me: Are you an actual person?Advisor 3: I will immediately forward this information to the dedicated team who will come back to you as soon as possible.Chat transferred: This conversation has been sent to another team. An agent will do their best to answer within 6 to 12 hours.What do we make of this? Are these people clicking on pre-populated answers?? Or even worse, are UE using AI even when the customer believes they are talking to an agent? Maybe a freedom of info request may answer?

review: I put a £25 order in for some groceries at the weekend, and when my order arrived I realised that I’d been given the wrong order completely! It was at least a £50 order that had turned up, and had nothing in it that I’d ordered. I rang the delivery driver immediately to tell him that I’d been given the wrong bag, but all he kept saying was ‘I don’t know what you want me to do’ and was absolutely no help at all.I then got in touch with Uber directly, who sent me a snotty generic response saying that because I’d been given a refund before on a missing item before they wouldn’t be doing anything to rectify the problem. So you’re telling me that it’s my fault that they keep messing up that badly, missing items and having to offer refunds? Once again, I stated to them that I wasn’t looking for a refund, but that somebody else had been given my order and I’d gotten there’s which must have left them extremely out of pocket given the size of the order! 5 minutes later I got another generic response, saying that they were closing the case now and encouraged me to leave a review about my experience.What an absolute joke this company is, I don’t know how they’re still being aloud to operate when they’re messing people around like this with such poor customer service. Il never ever ever use them again!

review: I used uberEats to order Nando's food. The order was successfully processed as shown on the app as I was anticipating my order the app showed the driver was on his way and the app then kept updating me that the order was delayed and it kept adding 3 minutes to the time as I kept checking the time it went past 20 mins app i decided to go out to check the driver as I received a text that stated the order has been cancelled and sorry for the inconvenience when i got to the gate the security guard told me the driver had a problem with the app and  he waited 20 minutes, but why was I never called by the uber service contact? I filed a complaint, and the chatbot replied that I was charged for cancelling my order, which I did not do, and that there would be no refund. Unsatisfied customer because I paid for food that I never received but was charged for. I am the type of customer who will always walk away without a fight, and UberEATS has let me down on a few occasions, which has really irritated me these days. As a result, I decided to delete the app and never go through such an ordeal again.

review: I ordered from a local restaurant from Uber Eats for a scheduled delivery about an hour and a half in advance.   The restaurant is only a 10-15 minute drive from my home. An hour before the delivery window approached, I received a notification that the restaurant accepted the order. I called the restaurant. They said there was no future time on the order and they would begin working on it. I asked them to delay it. They called me back a few minutes later and said that the Uber driver would be arriving 40 minutes in advance of the delivery window to pick up the order and they needed to start work on it. I told them I was going to cancel the order.When I got on the app, I was able to cancel the order, but I was informed that because the restaurant had accepted the order and began preparing it, I would be charged so the restaurant could be paid.There was no way Support were going to refund the monies.The problem as I saw it was the app or the Uber Eats process of releasing the order prematurely. I didn't want it early for a cold dinner. There is no way for me to complain to Uber for this issue, thus I must resort to this review to complain and hope that they will fix the process. I won't be using Uber again.

review: I was at home waiting for my delivery yesterday. Then received a phone call saying your delivery person is trying to reach you. There was no sound from him in the call so went into the messages, I described where I was living again. He could not find the place, then I heard a motorbike sound. After a couple of seconds I wrote I think I heard you. I looked through the balcony and saw a motorbike. It was pretty far from the building where I live. He said "Come down and get it" It was very rude but I did not care. ı said you seem like you are at the wrong place but I will come down anyway. I immediately went down and saw that it was not him again immediately. I have called him multiple times and he did not pick up. He has taken a photo of the order standing in the middle of a random street. I have searched for my order on the streets in cold for half an hour. I could not find it. Please could you tell me if is this normal? It is acceptable? You are saying that the delivery partner tried to contact you and waited long enough. ?No he has not. He has not. This is exactly what happened. No this is not normal. I have done my best, I did nothing wrong. I am furious. I will never ever use Uber Eats or any Uber app again.

review: First and last time I'll use Ubereats.  Food was running 20 minute behind the latest expected time, no big deal it happens, but we were listening out for it.  Got a phonecall with an automated message saying Ubereats driver was trying to contact me, but no option to speak the driver?!My partner went straight out the front door to look for him but no sign.  I got an e-mail receipt 30 seconds later saying the food have been delivered to number 7, I live at number 34 and you could clearly see the correct address on the initial order.  It wasn't in the garden of number 7 either (just across the road from us so we'd have seen a car pull up if that's where it had been left). and the photograph doesn't match the garden of where it was supposedly delivered to.  Despite having photographic evidence of the food being dumped at the wrong address and the driver recording it as being delivered to the wrong house number, Ubereats still refused to refund!Edit: If you order through Paypal you can't open a dispute if you don't receive your order.  Also Uber set up an automated payment on my Paypal, which they didn't cancel once they'd already taken the initial payment, so beware of them taking duplicate transactions.  I'll be closing my account and double checking my bank statements as I don't trust this awful, dishonest company.  Fortunately I was able to get a refund from the restaurant as we order from them regularly (unfortunately they stopped taking orders through Deliveroo hence using Ubereats).  However, I'm shocked at the appalling service from Ubereats, especially being accused of lying and giving the wrong address/phone number on the order. Also apparently it's perfectly fine to dump food in random people's gardens and call it a delivery service! Never had a comparable experience in my years of using Just Eat and Deliveroo.

I complained to uber and even advised them to check the drivers messages plus the miss calls. The only response I got was the driver attempted to deliver so on that basis I was still charged and they will not give me a refund. Personally I will never be using them again. Bunch of cons

Rang Uber and they said there was a miscommunication but that my groceries were definitely getting delivered. A driver called me to ask for the pin code saying they need it to cancel the order. I gave it to him thinking they would sort it out. I asked him what's going to happen next, is he gonna reorder, are the groceries with him, is he coming to my house? He wouldn't answer properly. He put the phone down and then blocked my caller ID. Reached out to customer support in the Uber Eats app and I'm still waiting for a response 1 hour later, still hungry, still no groceries on my doorstep.

review: They used to have really good customer service but it is now one of the worst experiences I have ever had. It takes ages to get through to a human and then you are met with utter disregard, and individuals who ignore your points, do not address what you are saying or asking for and are wholly unhelpful. My order was repeatedly delayed when they couldn’t find a driver despite my food being ready which then sat there for over 40 minutes. I asked them to cancel since they couldn’t deliver it and I was just told to keep waiting and eventually someone will bring it. By this point I had given up and started making myself dinner it had been so long. I continued to ask to cancel and be refunded but the agent was like speaking to a brick wall continually spewing the same rhetoric lacking any real apology or empathy for their shoddy service. He attempted to blame the driver and when I was allocated a driver the app told me that they were actually going to complete another delivery first before bringing my food. By this point my food was surely rock hard but again the customer service agent didn’t care and when I asked for their name to include in my review they promptly ended the chat with me and didn’t answer any of my remaining concerns.  By far the worst customer service I’ve ever seen. Their username was msidiq1. Needless to say, my food showed up cold and rock hard and went straight in the bin. (Pad Thai with the noodles had formed an inseparable block). I once again flagged this and was given some money off but still had to pay £5 for this inedible block and the time I wasted speaking to their shoddy customer service agent. Beyond belief!! If they simply cancelled the £12 order and refunded me when it hasn’t left the restaurant this could have all been avoided.

review: Uber eats is a great service but can be rather expensive when including the service fee, delivery fee and the obvious extra price hikes on food in comparison to ordering directly from the takeaway. One thing that they have always offered though is discount codes and promotions sent via email promotions, unfortunately it seems that recently these promotions are all pure marketing tactics which include “fake” discounts.I have recently received no fewer than four separate offers for discounts on food delivery with the latest being 50% off which even tempted me to join Uber one to save a little on deliveries as the offer could be used 5 times. Luckily I didn’t as the promotion along with the previous three is available to use at no stores. After searching for a support number I contacted Uber eats support via X where a team member was happy to help, I confirmed my account details and sent proof of my payment card and eagerly awaited a response. After no reply after a few hours I messaged again… and again… and again to continuously be ignored for several days now. I have been searching for contact details on how to make an official complaint regarding false advertisement and marketing but have failed so far, I shall continue to search for any kind of contact details while I enjoy a delicious take away delivered by Deliveroo.

The tracker said 3 times it was looking for a new driver. This went on until 7:30 when a driver was finally assigned, saying it would be delivered at 7:45 because he had to deliver to someone else first. Obviously the food arrived stone cold and milkshakes melted. We phoned customer service who were no help at all and seem to think because they delivered within 55 minutes there's not an issue. We paid £27 for food and drinks that were inedible. They said they can't refund us, get in touch with McDonald's. McDonald's said it's Uber Eats that need to refund. Round and round in circles we went, Uber Eats refused a refund because they're following their ridiculous "policy". Worst company I've ever dealt with, will never be using them again. 55 minutes for food and milkshakes to sit out, really? Get a grip you money grabbing scammers.

review: Most horrible experience ever, you order your food and then it's in a black hole, the estimated delivery time just moves forward, the map which is supposed to show your driver shows a picture of a car not moving for 1h, and sometimes just shows your location for half an hour, with no driver at all, no transparency, and during the time of waiting for the food I would manage both to cook it myself AND go to a restaurant. Waiting over an hour and still no idea where my food is or if it's coming at all. It's not a delivery of a wardrobe, when people order food they are typically hungry! I also read the driver can drop your order any time, they are just polling for drivers like for taxis. Totally unreliable system.Update - so I got my food and the bill with the times. The restaurant took 30 minutes and the driver took 50 minutes to drive 5 km by car. He basically started driving a few mins before the latest delivery time, from a city part that has nothing to do with the restaurant.

review: Awful service. I ordered a McDonald’s via their app. An hour later the food arrived, but not before it was delivered to the wrong address. After 25 minutes of trying to communicate to the driver- the food was delivered to me at the correct address. By this time not only was  the food stone cold, it was also a wrong order. When I called their CS number. I was told that the food was delivered satisfactory according to him. That was the end of it.It would appear that Uber Eats is more than happy to take your money and as long as they deliver something. It doesn’t matter what it is- or even the correct order. Everyone I have spoken to were rude, unhelpful and patronising. I’d steer clear from ordering. Especially in the Stamford area! Appalling service.

review: Just ordered lunch from mac ds on the app .I normal use just eat much better service .My food arrived stone cold absolutely disgusting .Went on to the app which suggested I call uber eats which I did .On looking at the order the time it was dispatched was 12.35And delivered 1.35I live within 5 min of store .Uber eats refused to refund me and told me I must speak to macdonalds if the food was cold .I explained the reason it was cold was because the driver had been driving round with it for an hour doing other delivery's. I called macdonalds and explained to them the situation , I was told although they have a policy each driver can only take two orders from store , they collect orders from all the other surrounding eateries at the same time .So uber think it's acceptable to deliver food stone cold , it's clear its not macdonalds fault .Don't use uber better to use Just eat if you like your food hot .I even tipped the driver! Shame on you uber for not refunding or replacing order .

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: I used Uber to order a set menu from KFC (New Lynn) that included 16 pieces of chicken. A number of chickens that are not usually counted.  I was hungry so I started eating right away. That day, I looked into the bucket and saw a lot of chicken wings. I got annoyed and counted how many chicken wings there were, and I found out that the total number of chickens was 14. With the mindset that I had to contact Uber quickly, I stopped eating even though I couldn't even eat two, took a picture to keep as evidence, and started writing a complaint. Meanwhile, the chickens, chips and potato gravy I ordered were all cold. It's winter, so the food gets cold while it's being delivered to your house. Can't you imagine what the hot food will be like after all the time it took to take out all the chickens in the bucket, arrange them side by side so they can be seen clearly in the photo, take pictures, and write the application form. I was so irritated that all desire to eat disappeared. I threw away all that food. And asked for a refund. The above is all included in the message I wrote while requesting help from Uber. Uber's response came the next day, not the same day. The result was truly shocking. Refund NZ$7.41. Could it be that the price of two chickens is NZ$7.41? So refund this price??  Uber's action to end the situation by only returning the price of two chickens. This is so absurd. I ended up violating my right to enjoy the food I ordered using Uber, but they don't seem to feel sorry at all. Don't try to solve problems like this, where consumers are harmed and where it is not the consumer's fault at all. Don't fool consumers like this. NZ$7.41?Take this money and buy two chickens for yourself!

My phone glitched which is out of my control so while waiting for my order I  never heard anyone know on the door or ring the bell. but when my phone was finally back on I got the message my order was cancelled and the money will not be refunded. I have to suffer and be robbed by uber eats because your delivery person is INCOMPETENT??? My phone rebooted on it's own so I have to be ROBBED AND PUNISHED for these things???  AFTER ALL THE YEARS OF LOYALTY TO UBER EATS...Just one mishap out of my control and I'M TREATED LIKE THIS.Wow..Other members of my family say that Deliveroo is not perfect but so much less stress than uber eats and ACTUALLY wonder why I still use uber eats. review: I ordered a meal, was charged £18.99 and the meal never came. I rechecked the app and the order had disappeared, so I checked my bank and the money had been taken. I tried to contact their supposed customer service, but a machine told me that they only deal with orders and there were none on my account, so they cut me off. There was no help available through the app, but I managed to find a chat service online. I explained that my money had been taken but there was no delivery and the agent said there was no order and closed the chat. I tried again with another agent, same result. If someone takes your money, doesn't provide the service and won't provide customer service, that is the same as a SCAM. This company is an absolute disgrace. I will never attempt to use them again.

review: Well the drivers told me multiple times that they didnt have a part of my order at the store, I understood and asked to get the rest of the order anyway. It is what it is, thank you for reading my spiel. <3 yours truly Daiyaan.

I called the restaurant and they said i had to contact ubereats directly. I contacted ubereats on the same day i received the order to report the missing item. I was contacted by a rep to state a refund of £2.40 had been processed however the item I paid for was £8. I immediately messaged back snd stated the correct price and asked for confirmation that £8 had been refunded, they responded with a generic "your refund has been processed" without confirming the amount.Lo and behold £2.40 is refunded to my card so I go back to the supoort message to escalate, they respond and say they cant refund me as it is now passed 48hours and i shouldve reported the issue then. I confirmed that I did this and sent them screenshots of the conversations where i asked for confirmation of the correct amount etc.I then received a message from support saying they had reviewed my case and would receive a refund within 3 to 10 working days, its now been 3 weeks since.Ive contacted ubereats againg today to complain to receive the same BS response about 48 hours. I dont care whether its a small amount to me its the principle that you have not refunded me the money i paid for an item that was not received and was also confirmed by the restaurant that it wasnt sent.I feel robbed. Since when do you not receive full refunds for items you have paid for, its literal daylight robbery.

Nonetheless I had an unauthorised charge placed on my card without my consent despite never ordering anything.I emailed customer service who took days to reply and simply claimed to be unable to locate this charge and asked for my card info again eventhough I’d already given it including a screenshot of the charge. I replied pointing out they already had that info and they never bothered to reply or resolve it.I emailed the ceo and customer services repeatedly and nobody bothered to reply, they simply stole money from my bank and then ignored me when I asked them to return it.I have had to lodge a chargeback with my bank for the fraudulent charge which has taken up a lot of time and effort to arrange and Uber eats are absolutely shameful.Do NOT PUT YOU CARD INFO INTO THIS SITE.They are scammers and will steal your money even if you don’t order anything. You’ve been warned.

Left a note on order explaining for driver about house being a new build, near the entrance and on the right.I received a phone call from an irate driver claiming I had given him wrong directions. He repeatedly asked where I was and I couldn’t tell him other than the info he already had. After nearly 4 minutes of his abuse I hung up. A short while later he delivered items. There was no sugar and sweetener as requested (I’d moved so didn’t have any) - the toasted sandwich was squashed next to the cake, which was warmer than the toastie.I couldn’t eat any of order and repeated contact attempts resulted in generic messages informing someone would be in touch. This further annoyed me and I asked for a full refund. No reply but 12 hours later, I got an email stating refund… upon checking I had been refunded £1.25.. not the £16… nothing I ordered was £1.25 & delivery was free so am unclear what this was.I am clear about contacting my bank to do a charge back and never using Uber Eats again.

review: Our foodcwas delivered virtually stone cold and we had items missing from order. It had taken the driver 36 minutes to travel what should have been barely a mile but route was convoluted due to doing other deliveries en route. The first items the driver brought to our door was a grocery order that was for someone else. It took him 5 minutes to go back to his car and swap the groceries for our order. Food delivered by Uber but ordered via McDonald's app. Although I ordered directly from the Mcdonald app, they won't do anything about it because it was delivered by Uber, I have to raise my complaint through Uber. I phoned Uber and they only accept calls for people with orders that haven't yet been delivered. Other than that, you need to raise the complaint on line. I downloaded their app but there is no option to raise the complaint as I didn't do my order through their app. So I went to the Uber site. I haven't used the Uber site to order food for at least 2 years and, to be able to raise a complaint, I have to input a code that they have sent to my old email account which I have no way of accessing. I have changed the email to my new email but, again, a code is sent to my old email before they will accept it. I will NEVER order a delivery via Uber again. Nor will I ever order food from McDs again. £6 out of pocket and our food was stone cold. 😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡

On the second occasion, he simply dumped the groceries and when I asked him to bring the groceries upstairs he said; 'I  am not going to deliver your order and I can't find your address'. I told him that you are in my building and I have just let you in TWICE. I asked him why he was not delivering the order and that I would complain. He said that I could complain and that he did not care. I have paid for the delivery to my flat and would like a refund for BOTH the service and delivery charge.  Do you really call this a 'service' and a 'delivery'????He threw our bread, pizza and ready-made meals on the foyer table, so that the fresh pizza and bread are now bent out of shape.I will never use Ubereats again.

review: I placed an order to a store that was closed. Apparently they informed Uber they wasn't taking orders, yet my order still went through. When the Uber drive arrived at the store he phoned me and told me it was closed. He then said that I need to cancel the order which I physically couldn't do. But he needed to complete the order to continue working. So I had to confirm delivery for the order because there was no way for me to cancel it. I then couldn't request a refund because I confirmed delivery, after finally being able to email them, they kept responding saying I'm not entitled to a refund. After emailing them many times that all they need to do is phone the store and the delivery guy who would both confirm the store was closed. After eventually drilling through to someone that I paid for a service which I never received, they turned around and eventually refunded me. However, they worded the email in such away to make it seem like I was in the wrong for example "To make things right, I’ve gone ahead and refunded you £25.33 for the entire order as a goodwill gesture.", "Please remember that this is a deviation from our normal policy under these circumstances, so I may not be able to offer the same outcome again in the future." So out the kindness of their hearts they refunded me for a technical mistake that they made. Worst customer service I have ever had to deal with.

review: Should give this 0 stars but there’s not an option for that..So I ordered a McDonald’s delivery using the McDonald’s app (it says powered by UberEats). The delivery driver tracker on the app showed him (KAMRAN A was my drivers name) as being outside, had a call from him to say he’s outside and I told him I’d be right there (for context I live in shared accommodation so had to make my way to the main door of the building to meet the driver for my food). I reach outside with no one with a delivery to be seen. He then phones back again saying he doesn’t know where he is, first something about a car park then something about a museum that was further up my street. Explained to him he’s too far up the street and gave him the name on a sign right opposite where I was and that I knew he’d be able to see from where he was but he still said he doesn’t know. Then says “I’m cancelling your order” and hung up on me. Tried to call him back but got no answer. It then said “order delivered” on my McDonald’s app but no delivery in my possession. Phoned McDonald’s and they told me to phone Uber Eats, phoned Uber Eats and they told me they cannot refund me or put credit on my Uber account even after explaining the whole situation too them and knowing I should be entitled to a refund due to not receiving what I’ve paid for. DO NOT USE UBER EATS! Whether it’s the McDonald’s app, another app they power or the Uber Eats app themselves, their policies are a joke sounds like something a 1 year old would have made up. Just avoid them at all costs!

review: First time using this company and never again. Ordered through the mcdonald's app, said delivery was running late, fair enough, it's a weekend. When driver was finally on route it said he was 15 mins away, then 5, then it changed to delivered. Checked outside, no food. My daughter was literally waiting by the door. It was food for my 2 children as a treat. I tried ringing and texting the uber driver multiple times, but you can clearly tell it's not a proper number. It took ages to connect and always went to voicemail, the provider none of us have ever heard of. Rang mcdonald's, they couldnt do anything, rang uber, couldn't understand a word that was said from either of the 2 people I spoke to. Their accents are so thick and they speak so fast you literally can't make out a word they're saying.I've heard numerous stories of uber drivers making off with people's food, selling it on the side and making out they delivered it, but I never expected it to happen to me! It was a very rare treat, which I don't have the money to buy another mcdonald's for my very very dissapointed children!I really don't understand how these people get away with doing it? Shouldn't they be vetted or something before being hired? This is people's hard earned money they're taking away, food from children, a very rare treat for a family who have had a very very rough few months. Disgusting.

review: In addition to exorbitant fees and surcharges, their customer service is the worst I’ve ever experienced. Yesterday I opened the app, saw I had a 40% off promo expiring in 2 days. Chose from the eligible restaurants and applied it at checkout. Everything worked until the last screen where it said the promo was not being applied. The order ended up going through but the promo was removed. So I ended up paying 20$ more than planned. This is also false advertising, I have all the screenshots. I reached out to support who told me they could not amend an open order but to return once the order as complet. I did just that and I kept getting transferred in the chat to the “specialized department”. I think I was transfered 5-6 times and they kept transferring me. Ultimately they told me the specialized team would email me back. This morning I got an email simply telling me how to apply a promo code. It’s like they don’t read any details and copy and paste generic help from their FAQ. I am livid honestly and am going to cancel and delete Uber and Uber Eats. I’ve been a customer for years but they’re scammers. Avoid at all costs

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: We have had multiple issues over this past year between being overcharged for quoted delivery fees, paying for priority delivery and then watching the driver go off-route into multiple neighborhoods even in opposite directions before coming to us (resulting in our order being 30min or more later than quoted & food cold), not being able to contact support & other difficulties with the app.   However, tonight sealed the deal.  We ordered from a restaurant that we order from almost weekly, and normally due to evening traffic it can take the delivery driver 30-60min to get to us once they’ve picked up.  Never been an issue before.  Well, tonight.  Katelyn picked up our order and AFTER leaving the restaurant with our food, cancels it because it’s “too far to drive”.  For 1) as an Uber Eats driver, you can see your entire route prior to accepting it.  So she should’ve thought about that before accepting.  But 2) our bigger problem is that rather than returning the food to the restaurant to be given to another driver, she STOLE our food!  We had to as a result order again, the restaurant had to make it again, and we had to wait another hour+ for our food.   THEN!!!  The driver who picked up our second order attempt texts us after picking it up, complaining about the drive being 20miles (no traffic at this point) and wanting a bigger tip.   No!  You ACCEPTED this order knowing the distance!  And then on top of that, had 4 friends in the car….one of the friends brought it to our door, not him…and they were all smoking weed that completely smelled up into our home & our food.  So to sum up.   Uber Eats let’s their drivers steal food & smoke weed & contaminate your food without consequence or compensation to us.  Never again will I use their service.

review: Sadly, Uber Eats customer service is abominable. Uber’s acquisition of Postmates made this worse. I placed an order through Postmates in March of 2023 (Order 9B99E). They delivered the wrong order, and I let Postmates know immediately, the same day. Postmates refunded / canceled the charge right away. Everything was taken care of quickly and easily.Four months later, in July of 2023, Uber charged my card for the same order. I contacted Uber support right away, and they said they charged my card again because the original charge didn’t go through. I let them know that the original charge was canceled by Postmates because the original delivered order was wrong. Uber support said that they could not do anything for me, as I contacted them outside of the 48 hour window. I explained to them that I contacted Postmates immediately, on the same day that the wrong order was delivered - That’s why Postmates refunded / canceled the original charge. Uber support kept reiterating that they could not do anything for me, as I contacted them outside of the 48 hour window.I went back and forth with Uber support for almost three months. Finally, someone from Uber priority support was able to credit my account for the charge in October of 2023. It absolutely should not have taken that long to rectify the situation. It almost seemed like Uber did not have access to the old Postmates records. In any case, it was some of the worst customer service that I’ve ever received from any company.

review: Hey UberEats crew,First off, gotta give props to UberEats for helpin' me make that dough. Seriously, thanks for the opportunity to earn some extra cash. You guys rock!Now, let me drop some feedback that's constructive but friendly, ya know? First things first, I gotta say, the tablet for accepting orders is legit. It's so easy to use, like a piece of cake. I can easily see and handle all the orders like a boss. It's hella smooth, and it helps me hustle faster.Oh, and shoutout to you guys for makin' menu changes a breeze. I've had to tweak my menu before, and damn, it's so damn easy on UberEats. Other platforms be playin' with complicated steps and confusing layouts, but UberEats keeps it real simple and straightforward. I can make changes in a snap, savin' me loads of precious time.Lastly, keep up the friendly and humorous vibe. Sometimes, the order game can be a bit of a challenge, but your customer service peeps always handle it with a cool and funny attitude. It makes me feel like a VIP, yo. That's the kind of vibe that keeps me rollin' with UberEats.Once again, big thanks for all your hard work. You guys are the real MVPs. Keep hustlin'!Peace out!

name: Michael Peel

review: I have been a loyal Uber Eats customer for several years. Often spending hundreds of dollars at once, tipping on every order, and a customer who meets the driver near their vehicle to avoid the driver wasting significant time coming to my door. I have reported only two issues in the 5 years I have been soley an Unver Eats customer. I am no longer an Unber Eats customer as of today. Today I ordered from a local restaurant and the UberEats App responded that there was an error and my order had not been sent. I made a second identical order and waited for the food to be delivered. Upon delivery, the driver brought two of the same order. Upon checking the UberEats application I see I was charged for both orders and tipped the driver twice. I contacted UberEats and informed them of the issue. Despite my several attempts to explain that the error occurred only because information I received from their App they refused to reimburse me for even half of the order. UberEats just lost a very committed customer. I have not used or explored other food delivery apps but will move on after this experience.

review: DO NOT USE I ordered and an item was missing. A pumpkin Spice Latte. It was the only reason I made the order but I added a few bits to make the order worthwhile. I don’t have a lot of money. I was made homeless after abuse and I was down. I wanted to treat myself So I tried to contact the driver first thinking he may have forgot the bag. I had two bags that had on them 1/3 and 2/3 suggesting there should be 3/3. He didn’t answer. So I went through the order connection thing to advise of missing item. After robot templates for 2 days where I just went round and round in circles, being told no refund will be allowed in this case and then going round in circles again, I finally got a human response. Yet they still wouldn’t give me a refund for £3. You may think let it go it’s only £3. But that’s a lot to someone recovering from losing everything. And I actually paid over £20 in the end for this order as I bought some extra bits. I was down and wanted a treat. They knew this as I advised them of it. I’m also going through an investigation for CA and so I needed a little bit of joy. (They also knew this in the end because I basically broke down verbally)For a huge company to be so petty to not give a very down woman £3 or whatever the coffee was, is actually disgraceful. I did all they asked. Contacted driver. Provided pics of the bags I had. But how do you take a pic of a non item. A missing item? It’s almost accusing me of lying. I won’t ever use them again. There’s no heart or compassion. They should be seriously ashamed of their “customer service”.

stars: Rated 5 out of 5 stars
name: DG

review: Company marks up prices of items to cover their 30% cut, often there are significant problems with orders that aren't properly addressed or even rectified, it is not worth ordering even with the 40% off promos because the 40% will only cover the taxes by the end of the minimum fee and you will most likely receive inedible or mishandled food/products in return, even when you do manage to get your order rectified and in some cases refunded, they usually don't even consider how much it impacted your experience(ex. You pay 24$+tip after charges for a subway meal but only the Sub was wrong etc, you will receive a computers determination of the original Sub price refunded before any charges, tips or anything. Which will most likely look something like 9.50$ for your 6-inch Sub. Leaving you out 15$+tip for some chips/cookies and a 500ml drink.) As close as you can come to highway robbery in consumers terms, highly recommend any other app as even food that is ready to be picked up will sit there while the driver is just outside on his phone(illegal while driving btw but what else are you supposed to do all day, your job?) or smoking in/just outside his car, rarely will they ever have proper food delivery bags anymore as uber can't exactly enforce it(or they choose not to) and your food is often just thrown somewhere in their car(a lot of the times on the floor because they take multiple orders and cram em all in there, which i want to state a lot of these orders would even be claimed by multiple accounts etc so a lot of the time your driver would drive right past you delivering your order just to drive across and deliver to a completely different address he had picked an order up for from a completely different restaurant in a different account, upon pointing this out tp Uber in their earlier stages, the support team with their tools would just say 'yea, sorry. We've helped direct the driver, he'll be there soon' as if he was lost or something and now your food is on the other side of the city in someones car dying(food literally dies it's the whole point of efficient service and standards) they don't care though because the restaurant usually gets stuck with the bill(thanks uber, really helping out small businesses with all the money you made during the pandemic and that 30% cut you take from them). People really don't realize how bad this is for restaurants and how it impacts the market(things we consume etc)

review: UPDATE: UberEats now refusing to refund this order saying the driver tried contacting me. I have checked my details are correct - they are, and also can show no missed calls, and door cam footage of my husband waiting outside to receive a delivery that never arrived to our address. COMPLAINTI placed an order with a local restaurant this evening and the delivery address was incorrect (it had defaulted to the restaurant's address for delivery which should have been clear to any one that it was incorrect!) I was unable to change the address by either talking to the restaurant or attempting to contact one of the 3 different drivers who showed up on the app; when I was finally confirmed a driver, I sent him a text message as he never picked up his phone; it kept going to voicemail. Driver never contacted me despite me leaving 2 voice mail messages and a text (he replied to a text to say he was going to deliver to the address I sent him, he did not); I now have a message saying it was delivered - however it has not been delivered. Also, it is impossible to get a hold of a live rep; I had to call the restaurant support line to eventually get connected to a rep, with whom I was on hold for 15mins and then he hung up - he had all my details yet never reached out to me to ensure my issue was taken care of. That is an extremely poor customer experience.How this situation was never resolved despite me trying to get in touch with Uber Eat's customer service, who then cut me off when I was trying to resolve it on the phone, or following the steps on the app. Fortunately the restaurant is amazing, and when we called them, they rushed an order through which we ended up picking up - a hassle we were trying to avoid as we're both unwell. Turns out, even the restaurant has issues with Uber and will be stopping working with them.

review: This is a review after months of being an UberOne member, and being frustrated not once, twice, or three times. But every other order I've had over the last few months. I consistently am unable to communicate with my driver. I leave extremely clear delivery instructions, and for the drivers who speak my language, it goes off great. For those (every other) who do not, I end up needing to cancel my order completely. Every time I call them (as directed by uber eats) they will pick up and say "No english sorry." I live in a big city apartment and there are directions necessary to find me. I don't order uber eats to spend an hour trying to find my food, and to be completely unable to communicate with my drivers is unacceptable. Please provide your drivers an AI tool that can translate directions. Otherwise, it's a service I have stopped using.Additionally, every time I reach out to suport about these issues I get snippy responses such as "I suggest you reach out to your driver" which I do try to call and unfortunately I don't speak a second language. I will work on that, but don't deem this my fault.

review: I am an Uber One member and I didn’t get the £5 credit from the late arrival of food as the membership promised. Actually there are no clear instructions on how this promise from Uber Eats works and it was so unfortunate this happened on my order in a Friday night that the food arrived a lot later than the estimated time. I thought I would get the £5 credit automatically but NO. I started to look for support as I found this was something I should be entitled, but I couldn’t find any contact point from Uber Eats’ site or app. Support service is not open to public which is the worst from the customers’ point of view. I tried by luck to get them answered the call by calling numbers from Google search results on Monday. Got someone answered the call but they were not helpful at all and they repeatedly said to me they were unable to give me the £5 credit as my ordered was placed more than 48 hours ago and marked the issue as “resolved” though it was not. I then asked them for contact as I couldn’t find one from the site/ app’s Help section, also asked him to point out where from the instructions/ terms say Uber One members need to report the late arrival of food in within 48 hours to claim the £5 credit, he repeated the same unhelpful answer, e.g. use the site/ app’s Help section, over and over. Next they ignored my chat no matter what I asked. When they don’t value the customers, not responding and disappeared like this, I found so helpless. It was kind of cheating as the rights from what they promised can’t stand.

review: I live in manhattan in a doorman building.  I had ordered from Murray's Sturgeon today.   My building has a  doorman and one entrance on the listed address spanning an entire NYC block.  Uber supposedly requires a pin# to deliver an order.   I didn't answer my phone quickly as I was on a call.  The driver dropped my food in front of a closed door around the corner, not on my street.  He/she took a picture of this, which I later found.    They refused to refund or redeliver. Ultimately, I got a credit of $25, about half the order.    Dropped at the wrong location, didn't collect PIN#,  wouldn't refund or redeliver.   Hundreds of orders on seamless and other services, never this type of problem. Bad service, customer service people not authorized to resolve issues properly, restrained by policy.

review: In the delivery instructions I advise that I am disabled and cannot walk so rider/driver must bring food to my door. I live on the third floor in a flat. Every time I get a phone call saying I need to go downstairs and collect my order. When I explain I can't, some of the riders/drivers have got pretty aggressive with me. My latest experience was terrible. I was told by the driver if I ask him, he will bring my food to me. He only missed off pretty please. He kept talking over me and wouldn't listen that I couldn't walk. He eventually brought my food to me and saw I was disabled. He said some people say they're disabled just to get the food delivered to their door! He also said Uber only give them so much time to deliver. It would only have taken a few minutes to get to my flat in a lift. I have complained to Uber and they keep asking me for more details. I have given them a lot of detail about this and past service, yet they've again asked for more detail, hoping I'll get fed up. I'd give them zero stars if I could.

review: When it comes to correcting an order and getting a fair treatment for cancellation, this app is problematic. First it’s nearly impossible to find a way to speak to a live agent via the app and find a contact number. I had to use google and contacted a rider support line. Secondly the app showed me a cancellation refund (minus an admin fee) but then charged me for a full cancellation. I had attempted to cancel the order because it didn’t accept an address change. But oddly enough when tried placed a fresh order at the same restaurant with the same changed address it accepted the order and attempted to charge my card which fortunately didn’t go though as they had deducted the cancellation causing the balance to drop. I really don’t want late night stress when I’m dealing with a food order struggling to find customer support, trying to change an address or navigating though a poorly laid out app.

Pretty dissatisfied. Will not use the app again.
