review: I ordered for the first time yesterday as we were at work and had very little time to sort something to eat, I ordered through the mcdonald's website and it's told that the delivery would be in 15 minutes. The front door was wide open and we were moving things around the front door so was never out of earshot. It gets to 25 minutes and we are wondering whether delivery is so I go back to the website and it said it's been delivered, I try to find some information on it and I can't find anything that tells me where my order is, so I try speaking to the virtual assistant chat bot, which was absolutely useless. It did not understand what I was trying to say and rather than putting me through to somebody that would help it just kept putting me back to the beginning. I find a number for uber eats who apparently deliver this, I called expecting to just either get told where my delivery was, that there was some kind of mix up or get a redelivery. I call and I'm left on hold a number of times and I'm getting frustrated because the whole idea of this was that it was the save time, I explained to the person on the phone that I can't just be waiting on the phone, they did not offer to call me back they just kept me on hold. When they finally came back to me they told me that they were enabled to give me a redelivery or a refund, when I questioned this they said that they had proof of delivery. When I asked what proof of delivery they did not answer me initially, but later on they explained that they apparently had a photo, but they would not describe this photo at all. They also said that the driver had tried to contact me twice but I had not received any calls.I asked him to send this proof of delivery and they have said that they are not able to, and that I have to take it back to the mcdonald's chat bot.Feeling very frustrated I walked the length and breadth of the industrial estate I work on, to see if anybody else had taken delivery. No other places on the road were open apart from a self-storage place.My phone the local mcdonald's that would have delivered this and they told me that uber eats are the people that should be dealing with this, yet we ordered through the mcdonald's website so our "contract" is with mcdonalds, placing me in a position of perpetual run around.Something that was supposed to be saving us time had me messing around for over an hour with no resolution.Absolutely do not recommend, I feel that I've been had by crooks, and I do not expect to be in this position when ordering from a company like mcdonald's. And for that I'm absolutely astounded!

review: Just one mistake ….   I try to order food from my favourite restaurant.    I picked my food then I press order ….  Then realised the my delivery address was my previous flat ….omg ..  I have to change the address .  I try to change the address .  But saying the I can’t change the address from app .    Come on …. Restart we’re still making food so I just wanted delivery address to change.. I went to web site . Try to change my delivery address .  Finally I could  change it !!  Yes !!! Then now they saying my new address of Flat is too far to delivery ….    Now this time ..  Maybe 5,6 min after I clicked order….     And what do I have to do??     There is the bottom of.  CANCEL YOUR FOOD ….  I think this is the only way no ?  I wanna still eat food but .  Too far to come to mine ….  So I cancelled my food after 5 min .    It was 42 pounds .    They said  your food has cancelled .  Will refund money ..  I was like  ok ….  Fu—— Next morning I got mail from Uber eat saying that food was already started to make so we have to charge …. 42 pounds …. I made one mistake of my delivery address.   And I could change after 5 min .  Then saying too far to go ….  Ok . Cancel it even I wanted eat ….  There is no potion .      They said refund . Next morning they said no …..  42 pounds has gone  . I even didn’t get any food .   I wrote 6 times to costumer serves . They can’t do anything ..  on the end they don’t even answer me any more …..            42 pound .     I mistake …….      Come on !!

I contacted them via chat, and also called the restaurant to contact the Uber eats restaurant support. The restaurant manager ask the Uber eats operator to contact me, and he did, but he didn’t offer any support. He didn’t care at all. I haven’t been refunded, and now after 6 days, the customer service reply to me and are telling me that they can’t refund me because it has passed 48h. It is my fault that they have replied now???  I have contacted them just minutes after the incident. I feel like a donkey, and this is unacceptable. However I will contact police and even take them to court if necessary. I am so annoyed. Use deliveroo guys, they have a very prompt customer service.

review: The shopper was great. She kept in touch when items weren’t available. It was a great experience.  Then, I saw the charge and noticed that the promo my daughter-in-law had given me was not deducted from the balance, and I called their customer service, which was not easy to find a number in the first place. It just went downhill from there now I have about $200 worth of charges on two different credit cards that I had in my wallet and four out of six people that I’ve spoken to you were extremely rude.  I was hung up on twice trying to speak to the supervisor. I finally got one supervisor who I thought was great and he fixed everything. 10 days later I’m looking at those two credit cards and the charges are all back, including the credit he had given me and the charges were on a second credit card. I called back had a fairly difficult time getting a supervisor, but not as hard as the first time. Then I got a supervisor by the name of Gabriella, who talked like a robot and repeated the same thing over and over and was no help at all. She ended up hanging up on me.  I called back. Ask for another supervisor was told I’d be called back in an hour and if they were busy, never received a call two hours later I called back again and spoke to another representative. Asked to have a supervisor call me and was told it would be five minutes and they would call me. I never received a call back. I will never ever use Uber eats again or any of their services for that matter and neither will anybody I know because everybody will hear the story. Good luck in Uber Eats, because you have terrible customer service the worst I’ve ever seen, I happen to work for a company who won the JD power award for customer service so I definitely know what does customer service is and what horrible customer services

review: We ordered food from a local restaurant because Uber eats offered a discount code on selected restaurants. We ordered at 7.25pm and the order said it would be here 8.05 but, as expected, it got pushed back to absolute latest at 8.30pm. It gets to 8.30 and no food. We then check the order which says ‘it’s been delivered 5/10 minutes ago. Check everywhere outside but no food. We call the restaurant who say it’s Ubereats problem yet there is no way of contacting Ubereats apart from a terrible customer services ‘chat’ which we had one response to and then silence. We had to quickly order from another restaurant if we were going to eat at all. I am over 7 months pregnant and get knackered in the evenings so to be eating at 10pm because of Ubereats and their shocking service is ridiculous. We were absolutely starving and it ruined what was meant to be a nice treat/evening. To have had no response on where the food ended up is what is most disappointing. Never again will we be using ubereats.

review: Complete and utter cluster. As an individual and as a family, we do meal delivery services on the regular. In fact, I work as a physician at a nearby hospital, small community, no more than 4,000 in the community and all restaurants within 5 minute of small community hospital. Never, not one single time, have we had any issue with either DoorDash or Grubhub or even delivery from independent local establishments.Working as a physician, along with all the night staff, I have crazy 12-hour shifts, typically 7p-7a. That means, upon arrival, myself and my nurses need to sort out meal plans early or the clock will beat us and we will run out of options. Thought I would give Uber Eats a try, for the sake of completeness and to give everyone a trial comparison.Big, big, HUGE mistake. Where to even begin. Place an order for the local Steak 'n Shake and execute the tracker so I can follow progress. It is about 8:15 pm at the time. Up comes the tracker and after only a very brief time shows my driver is at the restaurant picking up the order. This status remains unchanged for the better part of 30 minutes. Finally, as we push 45-60 minutes, the tracker reads "Oops, finding another driver". This is after 45-60 minutes and now we don't even have a driver?!After about 30 minutes of "Oops" persisting, the net result of this is very obvious, Uber doesn't have a driver available in this area, we are at one hour, clearly not going to make it before the "absolute latest" time, and my options are dwindling. Total time greater than one hour, "Oops no driver" time greater than 30 minutes. It was abundantly clear that the food was not going to be delivered in time, let alone probably not at all.I contact agents via the Uber Eats online chat and try to relate this and the urgency in resolving the issue so I can move on and still look at dining options for the night. All I got was a bunch of canned "we're sorry for the inconvenience" and reading from prepared scripts. I was still about 15 minutes out from the drop-dead time, but it was completely clear where we were headed for this and, if we get this resolved now, I can place another order with another delivery service, my only chance for eating anything other than a Crustable from the vending machine.Still...canned responses, scripts, etc. The suggestion was that "the food is technically not late until 9:15 pm and it is already prepared, so we cannot refund unless it is after 9:15". The thing is, it only would take about two minutes to realize that no delivery in > 1 hour and persistent "Oops, finding another driver" means that it just isn't going to happen, quite clearly at this point, so do me a favor and consider and a half to be late enough to give me time to still find something.Even the suggestion that a burger, fries, and shake made over an hour earlier would still be edible is pretty absurd. It is quite clear, Uber didn't have a driver anywhere near this small town and left me hanging for about an hour and a half while I was the only one apparently smart enough to figure that. When 9:15 did roll around, the status still read "Oops, finding another driver". No meal tonight, on the damned computer much of the first two hours of work, and the complete failure of customer service to make any effort to actually understand the problem and address the problem.Took me exactly two times to realize that Uber Eats either lacks the footprint or business plan to successfully practice this model. Among the most abysmal customer service experiences I have encountered for some time.

review: They do not believe in following FDA Food Safety Guidelines as outlined by United States Law. When my food has sat out for over 2 hours, they refuse a refund even though it is not food safe and could send a person to the hospital. If you want to have safe food, you have to pay a premium price. This should be illegal - you are charging customers extra should you "not want Uber to break the law" and send your family to the hospital with food poisoning. It is not the restaurants' fault - the fault lies solely with this negligent company. I am reporting them to the FDA and encourage everyone to do so. In case you've never worked in the Food Service Industry - any meat or dairy product that has sat out at temperatures over 40 degrees for over 1 hour is considered dangerous and not food safe. Food poisoning bacteria begin to grow on the food after this time and at these temperatures. They also lie and tell me that their drivers always use heating/warming bags, but never once in about 60+ orders has an UberEats driver used such a bag to keep the food hot. This website asked me for "date of experience" but this is a recurring problem and the Customer Service Agents refuse to address the illegalities of their practices or refund money for unsafe food. I have had multiple orders be picked up and driven around town for literally over 2 hours, to arrive ice cold and unsafe. Their answer is to "show a photo" then say it looks "good". That is not how Food Safety Inspections are done, by photo. The 'food safety clock' starts ticking the moment the potentially hazardous (if improperly handled) foods have left the refrigerator, not the store, as well. Every restaurant adheres to this or gets shut down when proper food regulations are in place. Uber doesn't care and they will NOT refund you in the case of food safety issues. When orders are wrong, the refunds are only for a portion of the missing items, as well. I had a missing order that never arrived a week ago - I did get a refund but they let the driver who kept my food keep the large tip I had left when placing the order, too. Never again. Call your local government about these practices and the FDA if you have also been wronged by this company. I am just glad that I have not gotten sick because I know when to toss it out, even if they just robbed me for $50 or more.

The 50% promotion was for a maximum value of $15, and this entire amount went to delivery and other fees.Again, this was almost expected. The reason I am giving my recent experience a 1-star review is because the delivery driver arrived more than 30-40 minutes later than the initial expected delivery time. In addition, the delivery driver's car that was displayed on the app was not the car that was actually driven to make the delivery. The restaurant also did not adhere to some of the special requests. Overall, this experience reminded me why I never use UberEATS.

review: Ive ordered a dinner and it never arrived as the restaurant cancelled it i was charged £29 for it when i contacted uber support they told me it will take up to 30 days .. i was really annoyed because this is a long time, however ive waited and the refund never arrived I’ve contacted uber support again last night and explained what the situation is they just closed the complaint by saying they can see I’ve contacted them before and with no other answer.. now i saw that its not showing me the previous conversation where they said it will take within 30 days and i do believe theyve done it on purpose … so here we go again im writing them again and this time the answer was that ive missed the “time frame” which is 10 days .. and they cannot give me a refund. For me this is a pure theft! They asked me to wait and now apparently ive waited too long .. i am strongly disappointed with this company i am a loyal customer and ordering very often from there but im not using it never again.This money i could of use em to fill up my car with petrol instead .. its not like its £5 its nearly £30 thats about how much my weekly shopping cost .. i am working very hard for what i earn and I'm not giving away money just like that..  i am disgusted of how you treat people and how you lying them i will tell all my friends what happened and i will also tell em to stop using your company as well! This is a joke!Even in the mean time while i was complaining and looking for my refund ive placed an order at my work place.. when i received the call that the driver is outside after 1min i was there and the driver has gone saying he was waiting for me too long and contacted me multiple times which is NOT true and there is another £12 GONE just like that… all together is nearly £50 haha Theres many other companies i can use which i never had an issue with .. i have NOT spare money to give away and im sure its not just me who feels that way and i truly hope more people are going to read this and see what you are doing

review: First, a store appeared for delivery to my address, only at checkout to show it was too far away. More importantly, I was charged approximately double what I originally paid for all the items I did receive. I was told that the “estimated total” memorandum was supposed to account for discrepancies between price and store, when if you read the actual message in the app, it shows it’s for adjustments in weighted items and replacement items requested, nothing about major changes in prices being charged for exact items ordered. I have repeatedly asked the company for an itemized accounting of the cost paid per item, and have not received a response. From what I can calculate without an itemized list of what I actually paid, I was charged $90 for what I committed to paying $45 for in groceries. Another difficulty in calculating the exact difference was the fact the store was out of stock on 12 items ordered and still my total bill went from $80 up to $90 with me receiving 12 fewer items. Apparently, Uber Eats is just fine with bait and switching a low-income family for double the price on our already small grocery budget. Experience was a nightmare, time sucking, rip-off.

When ordering I choose standard delivery and rather gave the driver a tip which was probably a mistake?! Essentially, it took over an hour to get my food (I could see on the app that the food was sitting at the restaurant for almost an hour before it was picked up). I tried contacting the driver who was just driving around and customer service how told me that it should be with me soon — what is even more frustrating is that you can see the driver in real time not picking up your order! When the driver finally picked up my order and even so he was already super late had to still make several stops on the way (again very frustrating because you thing you finally get your food only for him to drive one wrongs direction again). My food arrived 20 min after the latest estimated arrival and of course was melted/ cold so I complained again (a very long process unlike deliveroo, where you get a refund right away), they had to write and email and in the end I only go a particular refund even so my whole meal was ruined!So because I didn’t pay £3 extra for speedy delivery I had to wait over an hour got cold/ melted food and only got a partial refund— thank you but never again! There are so many competitors with much better service out there!

Me and my two friends ordered 3 burgers 3 Fries, 1 cookie and one chicken box with (3x legs 3x Thighs and 3 crunchy nuggets), some sauce for the gravy,  cutleries and napkinsWe got no napkins, no cutleries, 2 chicken thighs was missing no nuggets. 1 burger was missing and we got no cookies. All in all we paid 40€. When asking for a full refund all we got was 2.5€ which doesn’t even cover the cookie 🍪 (3.5€).I tried to appeal but the second I did they deleted our conversations and ghosted us. Before I forget to mention it, the driver didn’t even park at the right spot and I had to walk around the whole building because he couldn’t follow normal guidelines. In general, Very scummy and shady company, I would never recommend anyone ordering from this company, at least we won’t be doing it every again. If you choose to order food through them… do so at your own risk

review: It used to be 4-5 stars. I've been with them since the beginning. They have increasingly gotten worse. Their time estimates are basically bait and switch. They'll give a short estimate to encourage you to order. Then in tiny subscript there will be a second "delivered latest by" time after you put the order in that puts a second estimate 20-40 min after your initial time estimate range. Now every 3rd order, I'm getting deliveries that actually deliver 20-30 min past this "latest by" time, getting close to 2 hrs sometimes. Then to add insult to injury, they put your account on review if you complain too much, because their broken system encourages inaccurate delivery estimates, and regularly breaks them. Basically they bait and switch you to order, then deliver in 2-3x the time estimate and give a pittance for compensation. I'm just going to stick to in restaurant delivery services, pickup or give DoorDash a whirl.

review: I recently ordered the Green Thai Curry with rice and I must say, it was an absolute delight! From the portion size to the flavor profile, everything was on point.First and foremost, the portion size was incredibly generous, making it perfect for two people. It was more than enough to satisfy our appetites and even left us with some leftovers for later. Value for money? Absolutely!The Green Thai Curry itself was a burst of flavors. It had the perfect balance of creamy coconut goodness and just the right amount of heat. Each bite was a harmonious blend of aromatic spices and fresh ingredients that danced on my taste buds. I appreciate a good Thai curry, and this one exceeded my expectations.What made this experience even more special was the handwritten note that accompanied my meal. It's those personal touches that set this business apart. It brightened my day and showed genuine care for their customers.Kudos to the team for creating such a delightful culinary experience. This is a hidden gem that deserves all the recognition it can get. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟Thank you for making my day, and I look forward to my next order!

review: We ordered grocery from Waitrose on 25 September (20EAD was the order number) and waited over an hour for the delivery to arrive. Whilst checking the delivery person through Uber Eats app, we saw that he stopped nearby our house and marked the order as "delivered". We were waiting for him door open but noone came. We immediately tried to call him but he didn't pick up. I also tried calling him from my mobile as well for more than 20 times and he didn't reply. After explaining the situation to Uber Eats, they wrote back saying that the delivery person was outside our house for more than 7 minutes, hence we were not eligible for a refund. In total, we waited more than 1 hour for the delivery which was not delivered at all.This makes no sense as the Uber Eats app asks for a code which we need to provide to the delivery person. And how come the delivery can be marked as "delivered" without obtaining the code from us. And it is not acceptable for Uber Eats to believe the delivery person without any proof of delivery.Very disappointing experience with Uber Eats. Such a shame.The next day we went to local Waitrose store to explain and they agreed to give us the fruit and vegetables from our order for free(excluding a milk, yogurt and bread, which is also weird).

review: APPALLING SERVICE Ordered from a place called K-Town Chicken and let me tell you, it was the worst ‘meal’ I’ve ever order (if you can even call it that) the food was stale, chicken was hard and cold, the burger leaked and wasn’t even packaged correctly and they had the audacity to charge me £4.5 for delivery which I didn’t mind paying at first, only to be given crappy food. I wouldn’t even feed my dog this crap. All the food was cold and dry, completely ruined my evening and I was at work doing a 12 hour shift. Tried to use the uber eats app, and it’s bloody useless. Can’t get past their stupid automated options and it wouldn’t even let me use a chat box to speak to an employee! You can’t bloody win! Tried calling them next and guess what? Bloody automated system again! Apparently, they don’t deal with ‘past order issues’ which is ridiculous because how am I supposed to know if my order has an issue before I get it? Dumb logic. And the delivery was delayed by another 20 minutes. Next morning, I called Uber rides and asked them to transfer me to Uber eats customer service. Lady named Hagar was unhelpful, didn’t bother to understand, wouldn’t even let me finish speaking before saying she couldn’t help me over the phone and that she would send a message in the app. I uploaded pictures an told her the issue in the app, and she then tells me she can’t process a refund and they ‘understand’ this is not the outcome I wanted. They’re the worst! I wouldn’t expect anything from the likes of them. Definitely won’t be using the app again, I’ll be deleting both Uber and Uber eats and sticking it Deliveroo; at least they have good restaurants and care about customers unlike these money hungry thieves.

I made it clear I didn't want any additional tablets because we use a software integration to manage multiple orders on one platform but they didn't care. £520 "joining fee" or nothing. We voted for nothing. JustEat and Deliveroo have both added our virtual brands at no additional cost. Seems UberEats is fast becoming a "Has-Been".

review: I recently used Uber Eats in the UK, and here's my honest review. While it's known for its speed, there's a catch – you have to pay an additional fee to get your delivery first. It's quick, but only if you're willing to cough up more money.On a personal note, I've been using Uber Eats since it first launched in the UK, and I've noticed some significant changes. Unfortunately, most of these changes have made it less appealing. The platform now charges restaurants over 30% of their sales, which likely leads to an increase in menu prices. On top of that, there are additional fees for delivery, and if you want your food to arrive faster, you guessed it – another fee.The "discounts" they offer are often limited to certain struggling restaurants, which doesn't really benefit the average customer. Due to all these fees and increased food prices, I've made the decision to stop using Uber Eats. It's simply become too expensive for what it offers.My advice? Consider alternatives or grab something on your way home – it's usually cheaper, more convenient, and fresher.

review: Horrible customer service. I had a driver who refused to come at the main entrance of my building and call the bell, he texted me in the app he has arrived and demanded me to come out and get the food. When is I told him I couldn’t come out he left and took the food with him. That’s not the main problem though, the problem is the horrible customer service which is also hard to reach. I texted them the situation and they said the driver was waiting already 7 minutes. Then I asked them why he didn’t follow the instructions already setup as a previous driver. They told me a million times he couldn’t  reach me and I explained to them a million times he did through the app and I did reply. I asked him to come to the building entrance and he declined and they continued telling me that my order is not eligible for refund because he was waiting 7 minutes. Like no solid reasoning and response to the actual facts whatsoever. I ended up being more pissed off at the customer experience rather than the driver. They could have just justified the driver, he could  have even been in a bad day, cool, but what do you do though as a customer service? You respond like an intelligent human at least according to what the customer is saying and resolve the issue in a way instead of repeating a script gaslighting the customer because you didn’t bother to read what was reported. Like never again. App deleted. I won’t be hungry because of that Uber. At the end of the day, Uber is not an essential service.I would suggest others to follow the same. We have the power to take down unethical companies like these. And at the end of the day even they drivers are their victims.

review: A dreadfully unprofessional and dishonest company. I've recently joined UberOne because they had an option to pay more for delivery to my door. That's correct, you read right! A pay more option to get my takeaway delivery to my door !! Marvellous innovation; I seriously don't know how I managed before.After several feigned attempts at my orders from unprofessional drivers who can't seem to find an address and read the delivery note instructions, I opted to start paying extra for a guaranteed delivery service to my door... or so I thought!Rather than go over the copious times I have had drivers abandon my groceries wherever they see fit, let us move on to dealing with Uber agents after such a mishap. The support or complaint service, or more accurately, the lack of support or complaint service.You will be forced through a chatbot, leading you in circles with another "help" following the link message. Feeling frustrated with the chatbot's lack of response, the last option was to call the main Uber line and was treated with thank you for being an Uber one member. Right up to being "passed" in circles to the right department or receiving, "I'm sorry about your situation, let me help by writing down your notes and sending you a message with a link because they will deal with your complaint." ... Receives automated chatbot message link, saying phone call was resolved, how good was our service.Do yourself a favour, and don't use Uber Eats. It will be a coin flip on each order whether you receive your delivery, with a chatbot and dishonest call centre employees just waiting to "help".

stars: Rated 5 out of 5 stars
name: SS

review: Terrible Experience: Never Using Uber Eats Again!Order Number: #3C953Order Date: 23/07/2023I had an absolutely horrendous experience with Uber Eats, and I feel compelled to share my frustration and disappointment. I placed an order worth £28.18 on the aforementioned date, and to my utter disbelief, the meal was never delivered. It was a complete letdown, and I'm still in disbelief that such a reputable service could fail so miserably.Upon realizing that my order was missing, I immediately contacted Uber Eats to report the issue and request a refund. Little did I know that this would be the start of a long and frustrating journey. Despite raising a formal complaint and providing all the necessary details, my money was never refunded as requested. It's incredibly disheartening to be left out of pocket after a service failure that was entirely out of my control.To add insult to injury, the food was delivered to a completely different address than my own. Not only did Uber Eats fail to deliver the meal I paid for, but they also managed to deliver it to the wrong location entirely. This level of incompetence is beyond comprehension, especially considering that accurate address information was provided during the ordering process.The most disappointing aspect of this entire ordeal has been Uber Eats' abysmal customer service. Their complaint service is an absolute joke. It's truly disheartening to see a company with such potential fall so short in terms of addressing customer issues. My attempts to communicate with their support team were met with indifference, delays, and ultimately, no resolution.After this appalling experience, I can confidently say that I will never use Uber Eats again. The poor service, coupled with the complete lack of accountability and support, has left me feeling frustrated, cheated, and deeply dissatisfied. I urge anyone considering using Uber Eats to think twice and explore alternative food delivery services that prioritize their customers' satisfaction and take responsibility for their failures.In conclusion, my experience with Uber Eats has been nothing short of a nightmare. From the undelivered meal to the incorrect delivery address and their woeful complaint service, every aspect of their service has been a disappointing failure. Save yourself the trouble and avoid Uber Eats at all costs.

stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: (Added to McDonalds as well.)McDonalds have “partnered” with Uber Eats to deliver food. I have found myself unable to use my kitchen for a couple of days, so I ordered McDonalds for lunch while work is being done.Food turned up freezing cold and solidified, with no means for me to reheat. Searched best way to get a refund, went through the correct channels to contact Ubereats. Uber refused to refund, as the order was “delivered within their given time” i.e before the last possible minute that gave.Went through to McDonalds via Facebook, and was given a £10 voucher. Not the full cost, but I accepted it.Ordered again today, stupidly. Turned up even colder than yesterday which I didn’t think possible. Uber again refused the refund. McDonalds have also refused a refund or to acknowledge fault. They don’t have access to Ubereats’s transactions.I have reached out to CAB over this. It may seem like a small amount to get upset about, but the point is that two days in a row I have been forced to bin all the food, as no means to reheat, and will not be compensated with my money back. It’s unacceptable, and I would encourage anyone to avoid McDelivery, as both McDonalds and Ubereats provide unacceptable customer service.
stars: Rated 1 out of 5 stars

review: Do NOT use Ubereats unless you have an entire evening to throw away being frustrated and hungry. They’ll reschedule your delivery numerous times, they won’t allow you to cancel it when that happens so you can’t make a new order, but they’ll allow a driver to cancel it after you’ve spent 2.5 hours of waiting. Original delivery time of 8:10. At 8:00, that changed to 9:20pm. The original LATEST delivery estimate was 8:55, and every customer service agent refused to look into the matter until that time and I was essentially told to get lost until then. All while the app says it won’t be arriving until 9:20 anyway. Then I noticed the driver was reassigned a second time. At 9pm, I tried to reach out to customer service, where my order was suddenly cancelled without any input from me. They said somebody else had picked up the order. I’m absolutely sure it was one of the other drivers who picked it up and then disappeared off the map. They’ll let a driver pick something up, then they’ll reassign the order (!!!???), and no communication will happen between the two drivers or the restaurant about who picked up the food and where it went. I was willing to wait 2 hours for cold soggy food but that was the final straw. Because they cancelled and refunded the order, I was again essentially told to get lost by customer service. Not one person considered this situation to be a real problem or an inconvenience. They don’t give a SPLIT sh!t about the customer experience. This service takes orders they KNOW they can’t fulfil all in an attempt to grab as much money as they can. I cant wait until it finally falls apart.

review: Unbelievably bad.  Every 5 mins the estimated delivery went back.  15 mins turned into 1 hour 25 mins.  The “no later than” time was exceeded by 20 minutes. A classic case of “make it as difficult as possible”.  I then messaged to say that items were missing and the response I get was, “thank you for your feedback!”  No less than a 100% refund plus a credit would be in order here, but it will probably take a fight to get that.  So Uber Eats relies on drunk people who can’t be bothered to complain and technology designed to frustrate.  What a great business model!  Please take your business elsewhere and show this terrible business that their lack of integrity will cost them in the end.

I told them I could prove he hadn’t tried to contact me but they said unable to do do refund. I contacted macdonalds who told me contact them again which I did with same result. I contacted Macdonalds customer service explained again and said it was definitely Uber thst should sort this out but would highlight this problem. In short I contacted a manager at Uber who again refused to acknowledge the problem was with their driver snd would not refund my money. I will never use delivery service again if Uber is involved.

I called the customer service and only thing they could do is to cancel the order and refund. I escalated to their supervisor only to be told that they can't compensate me for 2 hours that I've wasted because they didn't know how to do their job properly and because I am not subscribed customer. review: What’s the purpose of putting delivery instructions in your profile if they are not going to respect them. I clearly have please meet me at the door and hand me the food.  In addition to my food I ordered an orange Fanta as well.  Well the app said the driver is 1 min away. Well it said that for 5 mins.  I just happen to go to the door to look out to see if they were out there and I saw my food sitting on the ground with ants around the bag.  And the orange Fanta was clear…go figure.  So I picked everything up and came in the house. The beve to waste on my hand and it tasted like seltzer water.  The only thing I could eat was the wings because they were in a covered box everything else was in the little open boat containers and I don’t know if anything crawled in them.  I tried calling the driver and it went to voicemail. So I contacted customer service through chat.  They gave me a 4-5 paragraph apology and a $2 credit.  Well the beverage it’s self was $3.39.  So I texted back and inquired what was the $2 for when the beverage was $3.39 their response was we’ve credited your account with $2 is anything else we can help you with.  So needless to say I will go back to DOORDASH!!!   I will not be using Uber Eats again. They can take those $2 and give them to someone else!

review: Terrible customer service & delivery service.I ordered food to my office when I was working late, something I have done countless times. I receive a call where the driver was talking to me but I could not understand anything (unfortunately he had a thick accent and his english wasn't very good - not the driver's fault but made communication difficult). Therefore I told him to switch to chat, where I typed instructions as to how to reach my office, even giving the store in front as reference. No reply. Tried to call the driver. No reply. Eventually receive a notification that the driver had delivered my food with a picture of my delivery left in the streets of London! Nowhere near original location.I have a picture of where he left the food (on the London pavement next to what looks like an iron gate to I don't know where - clearly not an office or a private address) and the map location, which is miles off delivery address. Despite this, they would not refund me the order. I am out 20 pounds with no food to show for it. Awful service. I will go back to Deliveroo for now.

review: Burger King on 3500 S. Meridian wichita ks (about on address) and uber eats .. no longer any customer service at any businesses that I've been in contact with lately. It's obsured. this is conversation with UberEats Chat person. just happened. Tue, Sep 19, 4:21 AMThanks for contacting our support chat. To help us get started, please summarize your issue below.the restaurant refused to fill my order as ordered before 3:59 am as stated on the menu and site. I shouldn't be charged for this error. The driver called me stating that I would need to reorder breakfast due to burger king staff refused to fill my order on the dinner menu even though I ordered before 3:59 am. I shouldn't be charged at all because I didn't cancel anu of it they refused to fill my order as i ordered the food I wanted this morning before the dinner menu was changed to breakfastThanks for providing this information. We’ll connect you to the next available customer support representative.Tue, Sep 19, 4:23 AMConnected to RajivHi Vinessa, we appreciate your membership. This is Rajiv from Uber Support. So glad you reached out to us, and I'm here to help you out today!Sorry to hear that you've been waiting for your order. I understand that you would like to know why your order got canceled.ahmed the driver called me from the restaurant stating that the staff refused to fill my dinner order even though i ordered before 3:59 am. and I nrerded to contact you for this matter and they couldn't help me. I am not impressed with burger king at all and then I was charged by uber for cancelling and that isn't right eitherIt appears that it will take a bit longer than I initially thought. May I take an additional 2 minutes to review your account?they said they wouldn't fill the order because now at 4:10 am when my order was supposed to reach me at 4:20 am the driver called while still at the restaurant and I heard the staff say they wouldn't fill the order and i needed to contact uber for a refund not them. but I could reorder breakfast if I like and I said wju would I want double the amount of money out of my account becasue the wouldn't fill my order as i ordered ityes please call ahmed the driver he will confirmThank you for waiting patiently.Vinessa, sorry for the inconvenience we are not able to contact the delivery person.Vinessa, what I understand so far is that you didn't receive the order however you have been charged, right?I shouldn't be charged at all for the 28.11 for inconvenience of driver and restaurant when it was them that didn't want to fill my orderyes it is out of my accountalmost 35 dollarsand I wasn't going to order more food to take more money out of my account and not this money back in it yetI can absolutely understand your point of view.Cancellation Fee $28.11September 19, 2023not right cause the restaurant is actually inconveniencing me and my family now so do I get to have you charge them the 28.11 and give it to me on top of my total order that I never gotVinessa, I am extremely sorry for the inconvenience caused by your recent purchase.I realize that this situation is difficult, I would feel frustrated too in that situation since I am also a customer like you and expect value for money.Vinessa, thank you for sharing your insights with us. It’s hard for us to hear that you didn’t have a very good experience, we always try to provide our customers with the best support possible.Vinessa, we are unable to provide you with a price adjustment for this order as the order was canceled at your end after the merchant accepted the order and before the maximum time of delivery. In the future, make sure your order is accurate before submitting it. If the store or delivery person asks you to cancel the order anytime in the future, you can ask them to reach out using in-app support to make sure you aren’t charged.the mrechant refused the order and I will take this to bbb and all review places online until you return my money to meI did ask them to reach out to you and again no help or customer service at all

They won't refund and won't tell me why. Days of messaging and they tell me that I have messaged them too much, I have had good many issues previously and they will not do anything regarding this situation. This was the first time I had ever gotten in touch regarding an order so that is utter rubbish. They are very rude and accusatory. There is no official complaints system as the only way to complain is through the same chat service. If you want to complain about a driver, service, customer service, it all goes through the same people who you just have to trust that they will take your complaint seriously even after they've made you feel awful about yourself. Desperately desperately disgusting company. Cannot recommend any less.

review: I placed an order worth €50, adding to the over 20 orders I've made throughout this year, on my Uber Eats account created in Nov 2017 (as soon as it opened in Lisbon).I can count on one hand the number of times I've spoken to support due to minor issues, such as incorrect or missing items. Every time, the support team was extremely attentive and resolved the problem.On this order dated 4th of September, one of the products was Salmon Tartare. The product description reads: "Shari, Salmon, and avocado cream", and the image clearly shows a generous layer of avocado cream covering the Tartare.Unfortunately, to my astonishment when I received the tartare, it only contained two ingredients, rice and salmon.I immediately contacted support to report the issue, expecting they would offer a fair compensation, as they always had the few times I experienced similar problems.To my surprise, Uber Eats' support this time dismissed any responsibility, stating that "merchants might not include condiments if they are not listed on the menu." When I replied that it wasn't a condiment, but a missing ingredient, and that it was clearly not only in the image but in the description, they responded that "Although we know this wasn't the experience you were expecting, unfortunately, we can't issue a refund."Following this unfortunate reply, on 5/09, I asked to speak with a supervisor and have since been ignored. Attached, I'm sending the photo of the product from the shop vs. what I received, as well as the exchanged messages. To conclude, I'd like to mention that the cost of the Tartare is €6.50, in an order of €49.39, which makes this whole sad situation even more ridiculous.

review: I'm fuming, I can't get out the house so I ordered a few grocery items using my last £20 and 8.30am, delivery should of been with me by 8.50am (I know its an estimated time) the latest arrival should of been 9.20am anyway I received an email at 9.10am saying my food had been delivered, I hadn't received any delivery, I tried to ring the delivery driver and also messaged him and I think he blocked my number, so at this point I'm £20 down and still not received my groceries, I tried to contact uber eats but an automated person said they priorities orders that are still processing and as my account said it was delivered I wasn't a priority and was told to email them and they would get back to me 24hours later, im sorry but this wasn't got enough as on my shopping list was breakfast for my 2year old, I rang morrisons (I know its not their fault) and a lovely lady spoke to me and told me it was actually her that got my order ready, she said the driver was very abrupt with her and actually made her feel uncomfortable, she said to leave it with her and she would see what she can do, she rang me back an hour later and said she got intouch with uber eats and they should be contacting me, they did message saying that morrisons had contacted them on my behalf and if I needed any assistance then not to hesitate to message back, within minutes I messaged back to explain my situation, this was at 10.50am, its now 1pm and they've not replied back!!I've lost my last £20 until i next get paid (which is still 3days away) and I still have nothing in for breakfast!! My 2year old went without breakfast because of a selfish uber eats driver that either stollen my food or delivered to someone else (I can't get out the house to be knocking on all the houses on my street to see if it was delivered elsewhere). I'm absolutely devastated that I put my trust into this company! Looks like my kid is having chips for breakfast for the next to days!, I litterally don't know what else to do as i have no family or friends that can help me. I won't be using uber eats again, their drivers have no customer service skills and the actual company customers services are just as bad for Not responding! I'm absolutely gutted and fuming!!!!!

review: For a few months, I had a monthly membership that was $9.99/m. Out of no where, I was charged $60 for an annual membership(this was in July 2023). I never changed or canceled my monthly membership, nor authorized to be charged for the annual membership. I chocked it up to a glitch, contacted customer service, and they refunded me. I continued my monthly membership for 9.99 for a month, then decided to cancel it all together, because I wasn't using it enough to justify paying for it. Woke up today to a 14.99 charge from UberOne on my bank account. [Follow along, because this get confusing]. Contacted customer service, asked for a cancellation and refund. I was told because I had already been refunded in the past(that annual membership I never signed up for), that they wouldn't refund me. So I asked why it was 14.99 instead of the monthly 9.99, he told me it was for a 3-month membership and I was "only charged 14.99 instead of the standard 30 for three months" as if I should be appreciative. He then explained it as "You canceled the annual membership, but kept your monthly membership, so you were charged for a 3 month membership." EXPLAIN to me how that makes sense. I never should have been charged for the annual. I shouldn't have been charged for the 3 months, after canceling it all together. And I shouldn't have been charged for 3 months PERIOD because I never signed up for it. He and I went around in circles for 15 minutes then he hung up the chat. The entire thing makes no sense; I'm out $15 now. I'm taking my card off their app and will NEVER, EVER order using them again. This is literally theft.

review: Just awful. There is no level of customer service with Uber at all. Their automated management of delivery can easily be hacked by lazy drivers and then Uber refuses to give you any compensation. Recently had a driver call up, rude, “where’s your house”, like the guy doesn’t have sat nav and I haven’t given exact instructions. Hangs up on me, connection is awful. Then says he’s at my house waiting on the app - “delivered, waiting” in Ubers eyes, but actually you can see him still cycling around the neighbourhood on the app. Then I am connected to the driver x3 and he hangs up on me. They will have data that shows that the driver was not at the property and cycling around randomly, and they have data that shows I tried to call him x3. But they only care about the wait time data, which is easily hacked by bad drivers. There is no cx, you can’t talk to anyone. They always side with the awful drivers they have too. Never using again. Deleting the app. Deliveroo is way better. Uber are literally thieves.

review: I placed an order and the driver picked up the wrong food. The restaurant called me to let me know. I reached out to the driver with no luck so left him a message. I immediately reached out to ubereats to ask them to get in touch with the driver and get him to turn around. They outright refused to and said the order has to complete. I complained and said that’s a waste of food, time and fuel. They can call him and stop this. They still refused. They said they won’t help me until the order completed then cut the chat. I reached out again. The new rep said he was looking into it. The driver decided not to cancel the order but waited for it to automatically complete. The moment this happened, the Uber rep said they can’t help because the order is live. Completely different to what the previous rep said. Then he cut that chat. I reached out for help to say my order was not delivered. They said it was and I won’t be assisted. That I would be emailed. I’m waiting for my dinner! I need immediate conversation not an email. So I called the restaurant and told them I will place a single item order so they get another driver. Uber then gave me a massive charge for a small order. I then used this opportunity to reach out again to chat to explain what was happening and to raise a complaint. I provided screenshot evidence. The rep said since it’s not a live order they won’t help and they closed it immediately. This is what happens when you support  or are forced to rely on disgusting firms like this. Deliveroo would never have let this happen!

review: Refusal to refund a food safety issue September 9th, 2023Today I ordered blueberries and raspberries as well as some frozen items from Target using Uber eats. When I went to wash the raspberries there was some mold outside but mold inside most of the raspberries. I took a picture and asked customer service to either refund the money or call Target so that I could pick up some good raspberries this week. They refused both and said there was nothing they could do. So use Uber eats to shop or dine in at your own risk. Yesterday when I ordered the same two items I did not get either of them so some of their shoppers need training. Before that, a shopper brought me tuna in a paper pack instead of chicken in a can. This is in spite of having photos of the items they are shopping for. Uber eats repeatedly asked me to give the shopper today a bad rating but that would not be fair to him as the mold may not have been something he would know to look for. Now this is interesting as Uber eats has no problem asking the customer to poorly rate the shopper when that person needs to make a living. Target would reimburse Uber eats for bad product but Uber eats does not consider it worth their time and would rather have food safety issues they refuse to address and poor customer relations. Beware big tech.

Then assigned another driver, who delivered the food at 10.20pm however it was the complete wrong order for less than half of what was paid for. We complained to Ubereats, sent a photo of the order we received, but was told that because it was delivered we aren't entitled to any refund. review: Company of 5 coming at Noon, expected delivery 1 pm.Restaurant said food must be ordered by UberEATS.Placed order at 12:30pm.  Screen info showed map with UberEASTs at starting point. Never left the restaurant. Delivery time changed by the 1/2 hour. 2 hours later called the restaurant and was told that the order had been delivered and verified.  NEVER GOT IT.  They agreed to refill the order and to choose a different delivery time.  This put us at 2:30 pm.  The first delivery person disappeared and a new one had to be called by the name of LEE.  I called LEE and got a recorded message. Another new delivery time was posted 3:30 Left a message telling him about the problem and wanted him to call me.  Never called. Another message that the order had been CANCELLED. Order had been paid for when order was placed of $95.  Manager at the restaurant was very accomodating.  The first order was verified as delivered.  Manager completed the order again for free with a few additional items.  We picked it up at 4:30 pm.  It was fresh and hot all within 1/2 hour.DON'T EVER USE Uber EATS for delivery.  Yes we probably waited too long.  But the Manager was very polite, provided fast service and provided a few additions to the order.  And our order was FREE.

review: Uber Eats has terrible customer service. If your driver brings you the wrong or missing item, and it happens frequently, they will more often times than not refuse to give you a refund. It is illegal to charge for a product that you didn't get. They can improve through hiring better employees by giving them better income, so the mistakes are unlikely to happen. They can also refund you when your order is wrong. Perhaps, they should implement a system where the restaurant is required to submit a photo of the order, so it's obvious if the order was wrong or something was missing. It may not be a perfect system as it relies on driver honesty and puts in an extra step for busy restaurants, but if they're not going to trust the customer when they say they didn't get something, it's the least they can do.

review: In Uber Eats, you only have 3-5 seconds to cancel your order and not pay a cancellation fee. This is very ridiculous! How come such a big company didn't think of this?!!!! At least after the final registration of the order, an opportunity of 1-2 minutes should be given so that if there is a mistake in the order, the order can be canceled without cancellation fee. It means that when the order is registered and the restaurant confirms it, the restaurant will start preparing after 2 minutes. It is very strange that as soon as the restaurant accepts the order, it is written in the software that the restaurant is in the middle of preparation, and from then on there is no turning back!! If anyone wants to cancel their order at this point, they will have to waive all the money they paid for the food, because it will all be charged for the cancellation fee, and that's too bad!!!! A few days ago I paid more than 170 dollars for the cancellation fee, I canceled my order in exactly less than a minute, but because three seconds after placing the order, it was written that the restaurant is preparing!! And when I talked to them, they only replied that the restaurant had prepared your food!!! How is it possible ?!! We all know that in restaurants, food preparation starts more than 5 minutes after placing the order!!! This is a scam!!! It is better to change the rules, I will not use Uber from now on.

The actual restaurant itself was a fast food place with a drive thru that 10 min from us, so I think that the platform just had trouble finding a driver. The food was cold by the time it got to us. I only used UberEats because I had a 60% off coupon, but based on how much more expensive the food is on the uber platform, I will not be ordering from Uber eats without a coupon because of how bad the experience was.

This has been happening more regularly over the past two weeks and when I answered the door I asked them what address they were looking for. They told me, and I said they had the wrong address and closed the door. The young man delivering apologised. However, the guy in the car shouted to me and told me I was very rude. I opened the door and told him I wasn’t being rude. I was just stating that they had the wrong address and shouted at me that it’s not his problem  and I said it was his problem because he read the wrong address to which he drove off shouting “ go f@%# yourself you thick b#%*^”. This was all captured on my ring camera. I was not rude I was not verbally abusive and yet I got spoken to in a very unwelcome manner. If I spoke to one of my customers in my organisation like that I would be fired immediately. I will no longer be a customer UberEATS.

review: Uber eats is a wonderful platform that has grown a lot but it still has a little ways to go. This was the first meal in about five meals that I've ordered off of Uber eats that was actually pleased with everything I bought. I wish that I could say that about all the items I've ever bought on Uber eats with the truth is a lot of things just don't deliver correctly or well. Also some of them have just been something I can simply make it home / very unimpressive. Like The Rice bowl company I ordered food from it felt very basic and dry and I was not pleased. This last company the Thai food restaurant was amazing and I would order online from them multiple times. But I wouldn't know unless I ordered from them before. That's the problem with Uber eats it is a wonderful platform to get things delivered I wish sometimes they would do restaurants further away and just make you pay a small fee because there are some restaurants that are far away that I can't access but I was still pay for knowing that the food would be like colder and I wouldn't care less if it was from my very favorite place. But I digress. This platform is wonderful I even got free delivery for the first time and I don't know how long. But it did help with making the choice of whether or not I was going to actually order delivery. Because sometimes the fees and everything after it all adds up plus tax just makes me say all right I'm going to make bowl of ramen. I will say that I checked my email and I had several emails that I let expire for multiple Uber eats deals. So if you're a person who doesn't mind the emails when you do want to use them they do have plenty of promotional codes offers and everything else. That I will give them an A+ on. I wonder if they do tests on the restaurant as far as does it deliver well within the radius that it says it can.

They did promise a partial refund ($28) but my experience is ruined and I just feel sicker now from the stress of it.

review: Order online at approx 6:20pm & advised delivery approx 7pm. Driver phoned with very thick accent & all I could make out was he was asking for password which was provided. As this was my first order I assumed he needed it to collect my order. At 7:45 I phoned restaurant to be advised order collected quite a while ago. Couldn’t work out how to contact driver or Uber. At 8:15pm found my order at my front door. It must have been there in the cold for 60mins. Order was cold & now soggy. Driver didn’t ring the door bell. He just dropped the order at the door.  Told by my adult daughter later that driver phones on arrival but as I couldn’t understand what he was saying when he phoned. Poor communication.  Very unhappy with lack of customer service. Our dinner was terrible & very late & binned. I should have just phoned direct & ordered.

When I returned to my phone to contact someone —why hadn’t my food been delivered—I saw messages that my food had been delivered EARLIER THAN PREDICTED and was sitting outside my front door!  Sure enough, there was my food, cold, having sat outside my front door for over half an hour.All the driver had to do was ring my doorbell.  Why is that so hard?  I was very disappointed with my first Uber Eats experience.

I ordered food bcs i was exhausted, now i had to clean up a drippy mess, take out the garbage so it won't atract bugs or mice,  and they expect me to spend more time diddling with the computer. never ever again will i order from ubereats.

review: Title: Disappointing Experience with Uber EatsRating: ⭐⭐☆☆☆ (2/5)I've been a loyal user of the Uber Eats app for a while now, but my recent experience left me extremely disappointed. I ordered food and eagerly awaited its arrival, only to receive it ice-cold.I immediately contacted customer support, hoping for a quick resolution, but to my dismay, my request for a refund was denied. This is unacceptable. As a customer, I expect my food to arrive in the right condition, and when it doesn't, I should have the confidence that the issue will be promptly resolved.The lack of support and refusal to refund for a cold meal has left a sour taste in my mouth. It's disheartening to see such a decline in the quality of service from a platform I used to rely on.I hope Uber Eats takes this feedback seriously and works on improving its customer service and quality control. In the meantime, I'll be exploring other food delivery options that prioritize their customers' satisfaction. 😔 #UberEatsReview #ColdFood #CustomerServiceIssues

review: I’ve had too many bad experiences with them at this point so this time, I’m done with them. Customer service is a joke and I’m really fed up with their arrogance. I’m supposed to get $120 back from superbowl Sunday because the restaurant canceled, they didn’t have any of those foods and didn’t know why that menu was even up, i got the money back from my bank, but then my bank reversed the charges due to Uber eats writing an email to them that I didn’t cancel in a timely manner and had enough time to change my order, myself and the manager of the restaurant called uber eats and burnt we were getting somewhere with them. Nope! So I never got my money back, I honestly don’t know why I still used them after that but today was the last time. I ordered breakfast from McDonald’s and this location does suck, because they always leave things out of the order. This time was no different from the other times. If there were other McDonald’s locations to choose from at that time, then I would have. I basically have long Covid so almost everything smells and tastes rotten to me. One of the only things that I can eat is the egg and cheese McGriddle. I basically have no choice sometimes, especially since I do not drive. They forgot something in the order for my son and also filled up his drink only halfway. That’s unacceptable. I went back and forth with Uber eats customer service and nothing got resolved. I think the workers feel like they are too above everyone else and are untouchable. The company itself is not good at all. No supervisor ever called me back no matter how many times that I called. They get away with too much and I will be going to the courts to try to sue them. This is beyond ridiculous already

review: Just to let everyone know how badly this company treats customers.My grocery delivery tonight was missing one item, a loaf of bread.Cost £1.60.Naturally I reported it to them and they simply refuse to refund the money.I've asked them about 4 times now in private messages to explain the reason and they won't.It's not the amount of money it's the principal involved.And all I get is cut and paste automated type of responses to my question.And no doubt they'll put another similar robot like response to this.And every one of their messages ends with the pathetic 'we appreciate your understanding'.Well I absolutely do not understand their decision and the matter was not resolved earlier.And they've still never told me exactly why I have not been given a refund.My item was not delivered and they've taken the payment for it.For something that they haven't delivered.That is theft.I tried to resolve this in private messages but they wouldn't do the right thing.So I have now cancelled my Uber One subscription and will never order from them again.So for the sake of refunding me £1.60 they've now lost my business for life.That's a pretty poor way to run a company.I would advise anyone thinking of ordering from Uber Eats to think again.There's a very good chance you won't get all your order and they'll take your money and not give you a refund.And treat you like you're nothing.Terrible customer service from an awful company.(Now let's wait for their cut and paste robot like response thanking me for my understanding).

review: Placed an order and it was missing a cheesecake. I contacted UE and they stated they would get back to me as soon as they can. When they finally messaged me, they stated that my order is not eligible for a refund. I replied back multiple times asking why, and I got the same message saying the same thing. I called the next morning and was told that I won't receive a refund now or on any future orders. Apparently, I've had too many already, maybe 6 in 4 yrs, and it has been a long time. How is it my fault anyway, that the restaurants are constantly messing up! Why am I being penalized for it? The restaurant should be held responsible for their mistakes. Maybe even removed from the app, or something, after so many complaints. Not keeping customers money when they mess up smh. Restaurants should be double checking orders prior to going out, seeing how the driver can't. We are relying on the restaurant to get it right and UE to back up their service. UE and restaurants are making money off of us by not giving refunds when they should be, especially for missing and wrong items! I will not be using UE again! Worst customer service ever.

review: We placed a McDonald’s order which was delivered 1 hour after it had been prepared. As you can imagine it was inedible, cold mush (it had been sitting for so long that the paper straw wrappers had disintegrated into the actual straws). When complaining on the Uber eats phone line we were told by a customer service representative AND a manager that this was acceptable and within their guidelines (despite both admitting they wouldn’t eat food that was 1 hour old). When I asked what the acceptable guideline was for food preparation to delivery time I was refused this because they’ve apparently been instructed not to give out this information. As a customer I’d have thought I should have access to the guidelines in signed up to. In any event, the rude customer service manager eventually just hung up on me. The delivery on just eat and Deliveroo is cheaper and you actually have a chance at having an issue resolved if you have one. So do yourself a favour and avoid these crooks at Uber eats.Their advert says ‘delivery without the drama’. That might be the biggest lie in marketing history.

review: Dreadful customer service. Customer service is terrible and practically non-existent when these issues arise: I never receive any help but what appear to be cut and paste stock responses.UberEats need to get their customer service in order or people will simply use different apps - which, while not perfect, at least have more reliable deliveries and functional customer service.

review: The worst ever food delivery company. I wish there was a rating zero rating for me to select. Twice this year Uber Eats drivers did not deliver the food I ordered. Based on this Uber Eats refused to refund my money. They had standard answers every time I communicated with them via the help support. They could not think out of the box. In my opinion, Uber Eats has given their drivers an easy way to steal from customers. They only believe what their driver tell them even when they have taken your food for themselves. There is no accountability. It is so sad that you order food and their drivers steal it and Uber Eats don't do anything.Following the most recent incident, I have had to go to the retailer I ordered from and asked them to investigate and possibly look into not using Uber Eats anymore.

review: Extremely unhappy with the service from the driver and the customer service afterwards when I'm trying to resolve my concern. After 2 hours the driver cancelled the order. No call, no reason, nothing. I had to chase up the driver and follow up everything.  He stated that he had collected the food, and had it in his car on the way when he car trouble. After I followed up, he did appologise, however,  no instructions or reasons to follow. I did receive an automated reply from uber stating that the money has been refunded and I can now reorder again and they'll deliver it when possible. Firstly, a 2 hour wait, then it's cancelled. I received a message on my phone that my order was being prepared. Great. Then another message later that it's on the way with the driver. Good. However,  after I had to chase up what was going on, I called the restaurant and they said that the food was never collected and still waiting to be picked up. Not ideal. Then I ordered the same order a second time. Was charged by uber for placing a new order as directed by the "support email". Once again, your order has been collected and on the way by a new driver. Just under 3 hours later we receive the food. When we bring it in. It's stone cold. Further enquiries, the food was never made again, and it was the same food prepared when we placed the order now 3 hours earlier. Unable to consume food or reheat due to moving into a new place and awaiting for appliances to heat, cook or even warm the meals ordered. Hence the reason we ordered in. Now, it's been approximately 11 days and still no positive action has been provided or any customer feedback offered. It seems its all automated. They continue to reply with the same questions, replies,  and responses when I have taken 3 separate attempts to get this rectified. All I want, is a team member to either message me via social media or email to truly attempt to help me. I've waited over a week before submitting this feedback, hoping that after 2 attempts on my end that it'll be resolved. But after a 3rd try from my behalf, I get the same automated questions that I've actioned and answered. Extremely frustrating that a customer needs to follow up Uber Eats mistakes. And after 3 attempts....nothing is done about it.

review: Appalling company! Ordered McDonald’s, and was coming by a guy named Daniel Viorel on a bike. He then proceeded to take forever to reply to my texts, said he didn’t know English down the phone and to send the address, I did this, he claimed he still didn’t know where he was going. I gave him directions down the phone, he then said he was here. My partner and the receptionist had been waiting outside and looking for him through the CCTV the whole time he was on his way. It got to an hour and he hadn’t turned up when he said he was here. He then claimed to Uber eats people he had delivered it but then another person said he was waiting 20minutes and no nobody contacted him. They are nothing but liars. Not only did they take my money of £31.97 they also took my food and refused to give me a refund because “he followed procedure” . One of the colleagues laughed at me down the phone, the other guy was arguing with me and just said “anything else I can help you with”. This is not how customers should be treated or spoken to. Im disgusted. Never will I order anything from this company or anything to do with this company again. I can’t believe uber eats staff can sit there and laugh and call me a liar, disgusting behaviour. They are thief’s and liars. Don’t order from this company, chances are your food won’t turn up and you won’t get any money back because they are thief’s!

review: The poor experience exceeded my order. To even resolve the extended delay delivery(1.5 hrs) I was on the phone and had 5 different rude chat agents. Then to have a supervisor call promised same day but to then get called twice 2 days later at midnight is ILLEGAL and wrong. When I reposted this, The reps keep emailing me stating “they are sorry for my order delay and cancellation.” Or send proof of order and when the calls happened. NOTHING! We are beyond resolving the issue of the order since I had to jump through hoops with rude agents for an hour after the order was delayed to finally get cancelled. To then get called 2 days later resulting in the lack of acknowledgment of this supervisors actions resulting in these reps copying and pasting a response is so unprofessional, frustrating and lack understanding. I provided proof of this supervisor calling me twice at 12:35am but I keep getting the “I’m sorry for your order” reply. Isn’t this against the FTC consumer laws on when and how companies contact you? And the fact I asked for an US based supervisor to address why I was called after midnight, I again keep getting the “we’re sorry for your order” cut and paste reply. If Ubereats cannot follow the US based laws for when and how to contact customer, they are in serious trouble. And I will be taking action with my state governing authorities for immediate action since my issue is being avoided.

First time I ordered Stella and got Budweiser (I didn't complain because the photos of the place were all messed up so I thought this might happen)2) I ordered a "strawberry ice" vape and got "strawberry ice cream". I could do a lot of flavour mixups but not that. 3) had a friend order £50 worth of beer and was quoted about 45 minutes. Several hours passed and we didn't have it. Finally called and went through a whole circle of them asking the postcode, saying it was going to be 20 minutes, and not getting it. At one point he also assumed I must be the wife of the man calling which felt insulting. Another point the shop owner hung up on us (I wanted to be mean at this point, but my mate took the phone and was lovely) Finally we got a call from the driver who was a solid hour at best away (this was roughly 3 hours after the order) and at this point it was easier to send someone to a shop to get everything at half the price. Uber has refused to refund him.

review: After repeatedly receiving promo codes for a substantial saving from Postmates (owned by UberEats), I placed an order. I needed to leave my house by 6:30 PM and I ordered before 4 PM. The estimated time of arrival was 4:40, and the latest time was estimated to be 5:05. This would have given me plenty of time. I kept watching the times change and finally called at 6:05. The driver still hadn't picked up my food and each time I checked his location he was further away from my house. He started out about 3 miles away and the restaurant is only about 1 mile away. At the time I contacted UberEats he was 3 towns away. The CS Rep told me I was next. Aside from the fact that I could no longer wait for my order, I can't imagine how awful it would be by then, after sitting around for 2 1/2 hours waiting to be picked up. The CS Rep actually tried to pacify me with 20% off of a future order! No. Just no. I canceled my order, and closed my account. This experience made me even more loyal to GrubHub and DoorDash.

review: The development team must be aware of this, because now there is a way for you to see in real time on the lock screen where your order isBut let’s say you’re not on the lock screen and you are wanting to look at your order. It is practically impossible to pinpoint yourself on the map because the receipt and the map size are too big. What would be a great addition would be a drop-down section for your orders, so you can properly navigate the Google map to see exactly where your order is Or better that allow the map to have its own individual page, because the map can be a little bit more in most cases more effective than the real time. At least you can see if they caught up in traffic. The concept of showing the map in the detail is great, especially if you’re visiting different areas and you don’t know the streets properly have an accurate map with all the traffic lights and stop signs But I really think it would be a lot beneficial for those people with larger orders to have a complete different page for tracking because this is absolutely horrendous, signed a fat fingered customer 😂❤️

review: I stopped using Deliveroo recently as the quality of their service has gone very downhill recently and now, I will no longer be using UberEats either. I have a long history of abysmal experiences with UE’s customer service but this latest experience  has truly been the straw that broke the camel’s back. I submitted a late evening order on August 5th from a nearby co-op, for 21 items totalling around £40. When the driver arrived,he handed me 1 bag with 3 items in it and asked for the code, which I gave him (assuming the rest of the bags were in his car) then he tried to leave and when I asked where the rest of the shopping was, he said he accidentally dropped it off at the previous address he was at and he’ll ‘go and get it’ and he’ll ‘be back in 10’, and before I could question him further he jumped into his car and sped off.Obviously he never returned. And of course, UE sided with him because I gave him the code. To be completely honest, this is the behaviour that I have come to expect of UE and Deliveroo delivery staff, as this kind of thing happens ALL the time across all these sorts of low paid zero hours delivery gigs. And while I have had countless frustrating experiences with UE’s customer service team, I have never had an experience this dire. Upon contacting UE immediately to report the incident, approximately 2 seconds later they came back with a copy-paste response to say they would not be refunding my 18 missing items, totalling £35 worth of groceries I never received. After days of back and forth messages on multiple platforms, they claimed to have investigated the incident fully, but refused to give me a single detail of their investigation and would not budge on their decision. In the end, I have filed a chargeback with my bank and that seems to be progressing in the right direction. I just really don’t think a company with such loathsome customer service rats can be a sustainable way to function. Such a deceptive and immoral company. Seriously, customers and employees alike need to stop putting up with this abhorrent service and boycott it.
