review: I would not give even one star for Uber Eats and its DRIVER whose name is JACKSON ANTONIO. Yesterday was my daughter's birthday. I live in Greenford. I ordered food from McDonald’s in the Westway Shopping Centre using Uber Eats. It was not the first time, and never ever any driver had any problem reaching my address. THE DRIVER DID NOT ARRIVE AT ALL! I saw on the app map that he stopped at the other end of the road, which was just a 1-minute ride from me. I texted him that he is in the wrong place and he needs to drive a little bit further, but he was messaging me back something in Portuguese. Then a message came that he tried to contact me, which was absolutely a lie. It was me who was trying to call him many times, but he just rejected my phone calls and I was texting him many times, no reply. Maybe because he did not speak English. After I got a message that he cannot localise my address and he had just gone away. Then I received the photo of my order being left somewhere outside the building. It was not my address. So disappointing. Kids were hungry. How can a driver be so irresponsible, with such bad communication? What he has done to my order I don’t know. I lost almost £18. Maybe it is not much, but how can I trust this company again, that allows such irresponsible people to work there, without knowing basic English? I complain to UberEats, but the reply was that I am not eligible for a refund, because the delivery person tried to contact me (which is FALSE) and he waited for 7 min to deliver the order (at the wrong address).

It only cares about money.I had a bad experience with an order which never arrived.  I tracked the delivery driver who visited several towns after collecting the order.  I spoke to the restaurant and discovered the delivery driver who was a MAN was using a FAKE ID that belonged to a WOMAN.  I reported this to Uber eats support.  They did not care about the non delivery, they did not care about the FAKE ID.  I thought the non delivery could be a common complaint but it appears so was the FAKE ID as the support were nonchalant suggesting this is not the first time this has been mentioned. stars: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

review: I placed a large order with a restaurant based on its proximity and time to deliver. I received a confirmation moments later showing that the delivery would be much longer than I expected and I had a large number of small children to feed. I looked to see if it was possible to cancel the order and there was an automated cancellation request, when I selected it it said that the order had been canceled and that I owed a cancellation fee of $339, The entire amount of the order. This makes no sense since if I had to pay for it anyway I may as well have the food delivered. The cancellation was processed less than 5 minutes after the order that was supposed to take more than an hour to prepare was submitted. I immediately reached out to customer service and it took two days to finally get in touch with them. They refuse to refund my money based on the order having been submitted and the restaurant already beginning to prepare the food. I went around and around with them multiple times before calling the restaurant only to find out that the restaurant manager said that the restaurant was not paid for the order because it was canceled, and they never made the food.I disputed the charge with my credit card company because I never received anything for my payment. The money was refunded to me but now Uber is billing me for it. I have attempted to contact customer service I've told them the restaurant was unpaid and didn't make the food and they've done nothing but offer me a $25 credit. The problem is that now I can't use the app without first paying the $339. The $25 credit seems a poor exchange for $339 for food I never received .I wouldn't have probably worried about it if they had charged me a $25 cancellation fee or if they had told me in advance that the order could not be canceled or would be charged in full anyway but none of these things happened. As it is, they expect me to pay them $339 for food that they never made and never delivered. I have tried to appeal to them that I can no longer do business with them, and that in my lifetime I will be worth much more as a customer than this $339 but no one seems to care. They just repeat the same information which is that they can't refund it after the order has been placed but in that case I should have been made aware of the fact before it allowed me to cancel it.

review: I don't use Uber because I have had issues previously with their Uber drivers, I know Uber don't care about anything but money. My friend ordered Uber eats to my place on the weekend, and the driver delivered the food and then left, whether he actually left I am not sure about. 30 mins after the delivery was handed to me, the driver was back and buzzing my unit, I answered the intercom as i assuming he dropped something inside the complex and needed to come get it. He told me he needed to use the toilet and asked if I would let him use mine. I decided to do the right thing because Uber probably wouldn't care to ensure their drivers have bathroom access, they are reputable for being a poor employer and poor service, so I let him in to use my bathroom. When he came out of the bathroom, I expected he would than me and leave, but he wasn't leaving, he stayed near the door, looking around at my place. He seen my cat and started calling it over to which it ignored. Then he proceeded to ask me if I lived alone which made it clear he was not there because he needed to use the toilet. He couldn't from where he was standing thay I had a friend with me, but as soon as I told him another person was with me, he very quickly got himself out of my unit. This is extremely dodgy as he clearly didnt come to my home needing a bathroom, he either never left and stayed for half an hour, or he came back to target me because I am a young female and he thought i was alone, and wanted to suss out if I lived there alone. My friend contacted Uber via the app and told them what happened becuse we both felt uncomfortable about what happened, and Uber just sent a generic response to pretty much say sorry for the experience, and shut the conversation off. They are not looking into this incident and the driver will continue to try look for single women who live alone. I already knew Uber would do nothing, it's typical Uber to not care.I am wanting to warn everyone about using Uber that their drivers are untrustworthy and will try and target perople home alone and try gain access after the delivery is done. Do not trust Uber! They allow this to happen under their watch. Stay safe and avoid Uber, you cant trust your address with their drivers as you may be targeted. I have never had this issue with any other delivery app, it seems to be an issue with Ubers drivers, and probably because they let them get away with it and do nothing. I am now banning anybody from Using Uber at my home, apparently not using Uber myesf wasn't enough to avoid their problematic drivers.

review: I’d give zero stars if I could!I will never ever use Uber Eats ever again! Let’s get this straight I did an order one the 11th of June which I waited nearly an hour or over an hour as 6 times it said on the app there relocated a new driver, further more I eventually received my food which wasn’t food by that point as I received it all smashed up and liquids had gone everywhere and let’s just say I wasn’t aware until I put the bags on the sofa to then see there what looked to be ice cream and coke now bedded into it so had to someone to clean it up because Uber eat’s clearly wanted to be ido**, anyway they said on the phone mind you that if I’ve not received my refund by the 2nd of August then “ simply” contact them… we’ll there was no simply about it, I had a bad time trying to get hold of someone as they refused to speak to me because I didn’t have an open order because it gone past the 48 hour mark when not being funny how else am I meant to predict the fact I was never going to receive that refund, vicious cycle as they tell you to wait 2 months for the refund but when it’s not there they refuse to speak to you, so at that point they opened up an automated chat for me on the app which speaking to a wall would of been more helpful! So tried to add on there the fact I spoken on the phone at the time as i didn’t except to be on the app trying to demand my £33 pounds back !They kept giving me the scripted words of “ sorry for the inconvenience but without an active order we can not refund you as it’s gone over the 48 hour” Blar blar basically more like they make you wait for 2 months to then tell you are not eligible for a refund!

review: I put in an order from Amir Ile Perrot $44.A few minutes later, the uber driver messages me that he accepted the order by mistake and that I would need to cancel the order otherwise his "score" would be affected (sorry).I didn't even know I could cancel an order but after going through the help chat bot, I accidentally cancelled my order from being bombarded by chat messages and options when I was just trying to contact someone from Uber (which is way harder than it should be).Then after accidentally cancelling my order, I'm able to speak with a customer service agent who tells me I messed up and there's nothing they can do for me and I'm now stuck with a $33 charge for nothing in return. For additional context, I've never had any disputes on my account and I've been with them for years. After arguing with the person they offer my $10 to which I respond with my dissatisfaction and results in the agent telling me theyre sorry for me experience, have a nice day and ends chat.I escalate the conversation to Uber (not eats) and the second person tells me more or less the same thing but, this time, with a $25 credit. Again, I tell them how that's not good enough, the DRIVER WAS NOT GOING TO DELIVER (proof available in the chat logs with the driver). Finally after arguing for a while, they reluctantly offer me a full refund as a credit on my account.They never addressed the driver situation which is crazy and now I'm left with Uber eats PTSD and no food that I was supposed to receive an hour ago.

review: These delivery app companies are ripping consumers off wholesale! I've been trying each and every one of them for the first time this year and they're all the same. Somehow, in spite of charging you so much to deliver your order, you will either get sent the wrong order or some of the items will be missing. When you try to get a refund, you're given a store credit that doesn't even come close to covering what was lost.For instance, I ordered something today through Uber Eats for $12, which--when all put together--almost cost me $24. Okay, fine, I get that this is the price to pay for convenience, but at least have the decency to give me everything I ordered. In my case,  of course the costliest item was missing and I was only given a $2 credit for an item that was over $6! And I was charged almost $12 in fees, taxes and tips! But I only get $2 back?This is absolutely unacceptable, and Americans need to start contacting the attorney general in their state to go after companies like UberEats, Door Dash, etc. Take screenshots of your items, customer service response, etc. and write your attorney general!

review: My recent encounter with Uber Eats left me utterly disappointed and frustrated. I had ordered from a merchant, but to my dismay, they cancelled my order right after I booked it. Annoyed, I had no choice but to place an order with another merchant, which thankfully got delivered eventually.The real nightmare began when I noticed the sum of £35.27 debited from my account for the cancelled order. Attempting to rectify the situation, I desperately tried to contact the merchant through Uber Eats, but surprise, surprise, there was no viable option to reach them! I had to resort to using Google search to find their contact details.Upon calling the merchant, they washed their hands of the matter and directed me back to Uber Eats, which, as it turns out, is no walk in the park to get in touch with. It's almost as if they purposefully avoid addressing pertinent issues like "Why was I charged when my order was cancelled?" in their Help page.After jumping through hoops, I finally managed to contact Uber Eats through an alternative means, but guess what? They outright refused to assist me since more than 48 hours had passed. Now, let me clarify that I did try to check my account just a day after the incident and noticed the amount was "Pending." So, naturally, I assumed the charge wouldn't go through.But no! Uber Eats decided to go ahead and charge me for an order that was cancelled by the merchant. What kind of absurd policy is that? Why should I be penalised for their inability to keep track of cancelled orders? It's ridiculous and infuriating!This whole experience has left a sour taste in my mouth, and I will think twice before ever using Uber Eats again. Their lack of customer support and the unjustified charges have completely shattered my trust in their service. I strongly advise against using Uber Eats unless you want to risk being ripped off for a cancelled order. A terrible experience overall!

review: Customer service is not assisting me and keeps fobbing me off or the person I'm speaking to leaves the chat. I checked out an order for the desired items at the desired cost. Which I have a screenshot for. Then 20 minutes after checking when my food will arrive. It showed up more than double the price and added 2 extra items  WHICH I DID NOT CHECK OUT WITH. I tried to contact the resturant to stop the order as Uber Eats app had clearly glitched. No answer from the resturant. I then called and messaged the driver to say not to pick up my order. No response. Before my order came I then reached out to Urber eats online chat and was told they can only help me once my order was complete!?! And then as you guessed it left the chat. Spoke to various other members of your team for them to also leave the chat. One said the chat was only to discuss live orders and they cannot help as mine is completed. Contradictory to what the first person advised.Therefore when the delivery driver came I took what I rightfully ordered and told him to return the two extra items I did not order (but yet still paid for)I therefore want the refund for the two extra items I didnt order and didnt accept. I paid £41 for one chocolate waffle!!Please tell me why your customer service continues to fail me on every attempt I make to resolve my issue?I have opened a dispute with PayPal which was my payment method and I would appreciate somebody contacting me. I have a screenshot of my correct order total and a screenshot of when it changed. Luckily I was able to capture this as on a different section of your app it showed my true order.I want my refund that I am rightfully owed or I will be taking this matter further. Absoulty disgusted. P.s I wouldn't mind if customer service were able to resolve my issue in a timely manner but to get no assistance when I have tried countless times is dispicable.Still not resolved. I will update accordingly if and when it does.

review: I ordered food on 28/07/23 and requested it to be delivered to my door. I added the entrance code to the building, the floor number and the flat number but the delivery person left it outside of the building instead. He sent a picture of the delivery, and it was literally on the floor, outside a building of 94 flats. When I went downstairs,it was no longer there. The delivery guy did call and I missed it (but called back a 4 minutes later to no answer). However there was NO need to leave it outside as he did. When I raised a claimed it was dismissed right away because it "had been delivered". No one read the details of what actually happened and they closed the claim right away. I raised a second one which was also dismissed because "someone was already looking into it", when in reality the other claim was already archived. I raised it yet again and all I got at this point was "sorry but as mentioned before, we can't refund a delivery after 48 hours". First, it had not been mentioned before, which shows they don't even read or check what has been said. And secondly, my original complaint literally happened minutes after the failed delivery. They have TWICE now sent the same message " sorry but as mentioned before, we can't refund a delivery after 48 hours" and nothing else. In 3 separate instances I asked to log an official complaint but it was ignored every single time. It's the worst customer support I've received in my life, on top of the terrible service I got for the delivery. Appalling.

name: Gagan Oberoi

review: I'm a delivery rider and I also order take aways frequently. I can say that between three major UK delivery apps which are Just Eat, Deliveroo, and Uber Eats; Uber Eats stands in last place while Deliveroo takes first. I rarely have any issues with Deliveroo since they were able to tackle its rider's wrong doings who were using fake GPS and hold orders while delivering food from other apps or even the same app in which the account might not even belong to them because most are illegal imigrants who pay rent for it.Just Eat has the similar problem and most riders use between 2-4 Stuart accounts (Just Eat), takes one order while holding their GPS from other mobiles in the same location, accepting an order in their different accounts, holding them there while doing another delivery.This really isn't fair for its costumers because they paid for the order and also for the delivery and they expect to receive the order nice and hot which rarely happens. I've e-mailed Stuart and Just Eat countless times trying to explain to them what goes on and they don't seem to care.The app that I consider worst for their customers, whose riders abuse their system is Uber Eats. Uber came up with a strategy to favor themselves but I believe it backfired on them and they are really losing money. Using as an example, Mc Donalds; If the riders accepts an order that is paying 2.70, most will not deliver it because it's not even worth the wait during pickup. What they do is accept the order but do not pick it up, wait for about 20 minutes then reject the order while a colleague of theirs is also waiting and see if that same order will popup on his mobile with an increased value which is usually doubled the original value. Depending on the riders, they keep doing it until it's paying above 10 pounds and they hope it pops up in one of their many rented uber accounts. I once ordered 2 milkshakes that took almost 2 hours to arrive and they were as warm as the sandwich that came with it and I knew they did this method with my order even when I messaged them asking them to please not do it. I reported them to Uber and I believe they did nothing about those riders which is very sad.As I said before, I'm a delivery rider and also a regular customer on these apps and I put myself inside the customers shoes when I deliver. I am terrified that these apps don't do anything to improve the customers experience while knowing that the major problems are the riders who are causing it.I'm only ordering my take aways with Deliveroo until these other companies decide to take action against these type of riders and start to favour their customers.

After showing proof of the conversation with the driver they still refused too issue a refund and said the reasons for it was apparently the driver made effort too deliver. What a joke of a company! Very loyal customer for many years with uber one membership and this is how they treat you.

review: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️. Very timely.  Very professional Uber Eats is a popular food delivery service that allows users to order food from local restaurants through a mobile app or website. Customers can browse through a variety of restaurants, choose their desired items, and have them delivered to their doorstep.One of the benefits of using Uber Eats is the convenience it offers. Users can track their order in real-time, receive notifications about the status of their delivery, and communicate with the delivery driver if needed. The app also allows users to save their payment information, making the checkout process quick and easy.However, like any delivery service, experiences with Uber Eats can vary. Some users have reported positive experiences, praising the speed and reliability of the service, as well as the wide range of restaurants available. On the other hand, there have been occasional complaints about delayed deliveries, incorrect orders, or issues with customer support.It's important to note that experiences can differ depending on various factors, such as your location, the specific restaurant you order from, and the availability of delivery drivers in your area. To get the most accurate and up-to-date information about Uber Eats in your area, it's best to check reviews or ask friends or neighbors who have recently used the service.

Last night I ordered food from a place with Uber eats and I was casually eating broccoli and the next thing you know I’m choking and heaving because a long brown hair was inside the food, I’ve contacted the company and all they say is sorry and refuse to give me a refund. They are a terrible company and don’t care for the customers at all all their messages are scripted as that’s all I get from them every time I have a complain. review: I was threatened and shouted at by a delivery driver because i did not have my PIN .......I live in a block of flats and had to go downstairs to collect my food , I did not notice when ordering a PIN number would be required , when i told the driver i did not know the PIN or indeed have it with me he started shouting at me that i will not get my food and will not get a refund , this shouting became more and more  aggressive and his fist was raised and clenched on a couple of occasions , i was then blocked from entering the lift to go upstairs despite telling him several times I would go upstairs with him and try to find the PIN number , after about 15 minutes of his abuse he finally came with me and looked on my laptop for the PIN , after which he snatched  the receipt from the bag and left , by which time my food was only just warm and I was left shaken  ........A report has been sent to Uber and i wait their reply.

stars: Rated 4 out of 5 stars

review: No food, no moneyI really should have looked on here first before making my order. I ordered from a Chinese restaurant and was patiently waiting for my food despite the delivery time increasing and getting longer on the app. Eventually it said delivered and I was surprised as we were home and no delivery, so we checked the door…nothing. I tried calling the driver several times and when he eventually picked, it seemed like he couldn’t communicate in English or he was just avoiding my questions. He never even attempted to call me to confirm when delivering. I was given a code when I placed the order but it is obvious the code is as useless as Uber eats. I don’t understand how my food did not arrive and I have been charged despite given a code to avoid this. Well, I then escalated to the help team who were very unhelpful and said I couldn’t be refunded after review. I asked them to explain what was reviewed and how they couldn’t explain how they arrived at h the decision and just replied the same thing. I was very hungry, upset and sad as I had just lost £30 and no food. Avoid this company if you don’t want to lose out.

review: While this was only my second experience with UberEats, I was not extremely satisfied.  The food was still very good, and warm (probably sat under the heat lamps an extra 45 min).  The final delivery driver was excellent.  I ordered food at 1350.  The problem I had was drivers kept accepting the job then 10-15 min later dropping the job, so my estimated 1420 delivery kept changing and finally got my food at 1521….one hour AFTER the initial delivery time and 31 min after the “latest” delivery time.  Not terrible, but this was a Monday afternoon (no holiday / special event).
